h4. *Priority:* ?? *Medium*

----

h3. *Issue Summary*

When a user deletes an *unposted* sales invoice, the system correctly displays a success message, but the deleted invoice *remains visible* in the list view until the user manually refreshes the browser.

----

h3. *Steps to Reproduce*

# Navigate to *Sales ? Sales Invoice ? List View*.
# Select an *unposted* sales invoice from the list.
# Click the *Delete* button and confirm the deletion.
# Observe that the success message appears correctly.
# Check if the deleted invoice is still displayed in the list view.
# Refresh the browser and observe if the deleted invoice disappears.

----

h3. *Observed Behavior*

?? *The deleted sales invoice remains in the list view* despite the success message.
?? *Users must manually refresh the browser to see the updated list.*

h3. *Expected Behavior*

? After confirming deletion, the sales invoice should be removed from the list view immediately *without requiring a manual refresh*.

column2: SP 22 - Unit of Measurement: Save Button Shows Error Messages on First Click but Works on Second Click
column28:
*Description*:
In the *Unit of Measurement* screen, when editing an existing record, clicking the *Save* button the first time results in error messages being displayed. However, clicking the *Save* button again allows the process to complete successfully. This inconsistent behavior affects the user experience and may cause confusion.

*Steps to Reproduce*:

# Navigate to the *Unit of Measurement* screen.
# Select an existing *Unit of Measurement* and click *Edit*.
# Make changes to any editable field.
# Click the *Save* button once.
# Observe that error messages appear, preventing the save.
# Click the *Save* button a second time.

*Expected Result*:
The *Save* button should work correctly on the first click without displaying error messages if all required fields are filled correctly.

*Actual Result*:

* On the first click, error messages appear, preventing the save operation.
* On the second click, the save operation completes successfully without issues.

column2: (SP21):  Stock Out Print Report Issues
column28:
h3. *Title: Stock Out Print Report Issues*

h4. *Module:* Inventory Management ? Stock Out ? List View ? Print Report

h4. *Severity:* ?? *Major*

h4. *Priority:* ?? *High*

----

h3. *Issue Summary*

When the user clicks the *Print* action button for a *Stock Out entry* from the *Stock Out list view*, the printed report contains multiple issues:

# *Item Quantity is displayed incorrectly* ? Instead of numerical values, an *unreadable/unexpected text* appears.
# *Stock Out Status is missing* ? The report does not indicate whether the Stock Out is *Posted or Unposted*.
# *Label Alignment is incorrect* ? The labels and values in the report are *misaligned*, making the report difficult to read.
# *Localization Issues* ? Many labels and text elements are *not translated/localized*, leading to inconsistent language in the report.

----

h3. *Steps to Reproduce*

# Navigate to the *Stock Out* list view.
# Select an existing *Stock Out entry*.
# Click the *Print* action button.
# Review the generated report.

----

h3. *Observed Behavior*

?? *Item Quantity* is displayed as *unreadable text* instead of numbers.
?? *Stock Out Status* is *not mentioned anywhere* in the printed report.
?? *Label alignment is inconsistent and poorly formatted.*
?? *Several labels and texts are not localized*, appearing in the wrong language.

h3. *Expected Behavior*

? *Item Quantity should be correctly displayed as a number.*
? *Stock Out Status should be clearly stated* (e.g., *Posted / Unposted*).
? *All labels and values should be properly aligned* for readability.
? *All text should be properly localized* based on the system language settings.

column2: (SP21) @General : Advanced Item Search Dialog Fails to Filter Items Based on Multiple Conditions
column28:
h3. *Title: Advanced Item Search Dialog Fails to Filter Items Based on Multiple Conditions*

h3. *Issue Summary*

The *Advanced Item Search dialog* does not correctly retrieve items based on a *combination of filter conditions*, such as:

* *Checking/Unchecking "Serial" filter*
* *Entering specific search criteria (e.g., item name, code, category, etc.)*

Expected behavior: *The system should return results that match all applied filters.*
Actual behavior: *Items retrieved do not match the applied filter combination or no results are displayed.*

----

h3. *Steps to Reproduce*

# Navigate to Inventory App > Stock In > Add Screen
# Click Advanced Search Icon on the Item Code Field to Open the *Advanced Item Search* dialog
# Apply multiple filter conditions:
#* *Check/Uncheck the "Serial" filter.*
#* *Input specific search criteria* (e.g., item name, code, category).
# Click *Search*.
# Observe the results.

----

h3. *Actual Behavior*

?? *Items are not retrieved correctly* based on the selected filter combination.
?? *Some applied conditions are ignored* in the search results.

h3. *Expected Behavior*

? The system should *return only the items* that match *all applied filter conditions*.
? *Serial filter selection* should correctly *include/exclude serial-based items*.
? *Inputted search criteria should refine results correctly* without ignoring conditions.

column2: (SP21):  Multiple Stock In Entries Created When Clicking Save Button Multiple Times
column28:
h4. *Title:* *Multiple Stock In Entries Created When Clicking Save Button Multiple Times*

* *Severity:* *Critical*
* *Module:* *Inventory Management - Stock In (Add New Entry)*
* *Environment:* Web Application

----

h4. *Bug Description*

When a user *clicks the Save button multiple times* in the *Stock In Add Screen*, multiple stock-in records are generated instead of a *single entry*. This leads to *duplicate stock entries*, which can cause inventory discrepancies and incorrect stock levels.

----

h4. *Steps to Reproduce*

# Navigate to the *Stock In Add* screen.
# Fill in all *required fields* (Warehouse, Items, Quantities, etc.).
# Click the *Save* button multiple times rapidly.
# Observe that multiple *Stock In* records are created instead of one.

----

h4. *Expected Result*

* The system should *disable* the Save button after the first click to *prevent duplicate submissions*.
* Only *one* Stock In record should be created per user action.

----

h4. *Actual Result*

* Multiple *Stock In records* are generated when clicking the Save button multiple times.
* No *loading indicator* or button disablement prevents repeated submissions.

----

----

----

h3. *Priority:* ?? *Critical*

column2: (SP21): Return Sales Invoice Add Screen Missing Walkthrough Guide with Instructional Steps
column28:
*Title:* *Return Sales Invoice Add Screen Missing Walkthrough Guide with Instructional Steps*

* *Severity:* *Medium*
* *Module:* *Return Sales Invoice (Add Screen - User Guidance Feature)*

----

h4. *Bug Description*

The *Return Sales Invoice Add screen* does not include a *walkthrough guide* that provides step-by-step instructions on how to use the screen. New or unfamiliar users may struggle to understand the required fields, available options, and correct workflow for creating a Return Sales Invoice.

----

h4. *Steps to Reproduce*

# Navigate to the *Return Sales Invoice Add Screen*.
# Look for an *on-screen walkthrough guide* or *help instructions*.
# Observe that no *step-by-step guidance* is provided to assist users in filling out the form.

----

h4. *Expected Result*

* A *walkthrough guide* should be available, helping users understand how to:
** *Select a customer* and relevant details.
** *Add items* and define pricing, discounts, and tax.
** *Verify totals and submit the invoice.*
** Understand *mandatory fields* and avoid common mistakes.
* The guide should appear *on first visit* and be accessible via a *Help or Info button*.

----

h4. *Actual Result*

* *No walkthrough guide* or instructional pop-ups exist in the Return Sales Invoice Add screen.
* Users may experience *confusion* when attempting to complete the invoice without prior knowledge.



----

column2: (SP21): Missing Walkthrough Guide for the "Fund Transfer" Module in Finance App
column28:
*Title:*
Missing Walkthrough Guide for the "Fund Transfer" Module in Finance App

*Description:*
The *"Fund Transfer"* module under *Finance App ? Transactions* does not have a *Walkthrough Guide* to assist users in understanding its functionality. This makes it difficult for new users to navigate and complete fund transfer operations efficiently. Other modules in the Finance App have walkthrough guides, but this module lacks one entirely.

----

h3. *Precondition:*

* User is logged into the *Finance App*.
* The *Walkthrough Guide* feature is enabled for other modules.
* The user navigates to the *Fund Transfer* module under *Transactions*.

----

h3. *Steps to Reproduce:*

# Navigate to *Finance App ? Transactions ? Fund Transfer*.
# Look for a *Walkthrough Guide* or an onboarding tutorial.
# Observe that no *Walkthrough Guide* is available.
# Compare with other Finance App modules where walkthroughs are present.

----

h3. *Expected Result:*

* A *Walkthrough Guide* should be available to explain the steps involved in *Fund Transfers*.
* Users should receive *step-by-step instructions* on filling out required fields and completing a transfer.
* A *helpful tooltip or onboarding overlay* should guide users through key functionalities.

----

h3. *Actual Result:*

* No *Walkthrough Guide* exists for the *Fund Transfer* module.
* Users are left to figure out the process manually.
* This inconsistency with other Finance App modules affects *usability* and *user onboarding*.

----

h3. *Severity:*

*Low* ? The module functions correctly, but usability is impacted for new users.

h3. *Priority:*

*Medium* ? Important for consistency and improving user experience.

column2: (SP21): Purchase Invoice Screen Guide Walkthrough Does Not Display Steps After Step 9 /13
column28:
*Title:*
Purchase Invoice Screen Guide Walkthrough Does Not Display Steps After Step 9 

*Description:*
The *Guide Walkthrough* feature in the *Purchase Invoice* screen does not display steps beyond *Step 9*, even though there are a total of *13 steps*. Additionally, an *overlay layer* appears without any *Cancel* or *Close* action, preventing the user from exiting the guide. The only way to continue using the system is to *refresh the page*, which disrupts the user experience.

----

h3. *Precondition:*

* User is logged into the Purchase App.
* The *Guide Walkthrough* feature is enabled.
* The Purchase Invoice screen has a guided step-by-step walkthrough.

----

h3. *Steps to Reproduce:*

# Navigate to the *Purchase Invoice* screen.
# Start the *Guide Walkthrough* feature.
# Progress through the steps until *Step 9*.
# Observe that *Steps 10 to 13* are not displayed.
# Notice that an *overlay layer* appears, blocking interactions with the screen.
# Attempt to exit the walkthrough ? there is *no Cancel or Close button*.
# The user is forced to *refresh the page* to regain access to the system.

----

h3. *Expected Result:*

* The *Guide Walkthrough* should display all *13 steps* correctly.
* Users should be able to navigate through all steps *without interruption*.
* A *Cancel or Close button* should be available to exit the guide at any point.

----

h3. *Actual Result:*

* The walkthrough stops displaying after *Step 9*, leaving out *Steps 10 to 13*.
* An *overlay layer* appears, preventing further interaction with the screen.
* There is *no Cancel/Close button*, forcing users to *refresh the page* to exit.

----

h3. *Severity:*

*Medium* ? Affects usability but does not impact data integrity.

h3. *Priority:*

*High* ? Should be fixed to ensure a smooth onboarding experience for users.

column2: (Sp21): Unexpected Stock Increase When Posting a Purchase Invoice Multiple Times
column28:
*Title:*
Unexpected Stock Increase When Posting a Purchase Invoice Multiple Times

*Description:*
In the *Purchase Invoice* screen of the Purchase App, an unexpected behavior occurs when posting an invoice. Each time the user clicks the *Post* button, the item's stock quantity increases. This issue is visible in the *Item Card Report* and the *Stock Out Add Screen* under the *Item Availability* field. However, the *Purchase Invoice List View* correctly shows only one posted purchase invoice, and the *Stock In* screen reflects only one *Posted Stock In* entry from the purchase.

----

h3. *Precondition:*

* User is logged into the Purchase App.
* The user has access to the *Purchase Invoice* module.
* At least one *item* exists in the inventory.

----

h3. *Steps to Reproduce:*

# Navigate to the *Purchase Invoice* screen.
# Fill in all required fields, including *Supplier, Date, and Item Details*.
# Add an *item* with a valid quantity.
# Click *Save* to create the purchase invoice.
# Click *Post* button *Multiple* time to finalize the purchase invoice.
# Observe the *Item Card Report* and *Stock Out Add Screen (Item Availability field)* ? stock increases.
# Observe that the stock quantity increases again, even though only one purchase invoice is recorded in the *List View* and *Stock In Screen*.

----

h3. *Expected Result:*

* The system should prevent multiple postings of the same *Purchase Invoice*.
* Clicking *Post* multiple times should not result in duplicate stock increases.
* Stock quantity updates should match the actual *Posted Purchase Invoice* count.
* If the invoice is already posted, the system should display an error message like:
_"This Purchase Invoice has already been posted. No further stock updates are required."_

----

h3. *Actual Result:*

* Clicking the *Post* button multiple times increases the stock quantity incorrectly.
* The *Item Card Report* and *Stock Out Add Screen* reflect inflated stock values.
* The *Purchase Invoice List View* and *Stock In Screen* correctly show only one posted invoice.

----

h3. *Severity:*

*Critical* ? Leads to incorrect stock levels, impacting inventory management and financial reporting.

h3. *Priority:*

*High* ? Needs immediate resolution to prevent stock discrepancies.

column2: (SP21): Exported Return Purchase Invoice PDF Report Has Multiple Text Formatting Issues
column28:
*Title:*
Exported Return Purchase Invoice PDF Report Has Multiple Text Formatting Issues

*Description:*
The *Exported Return Purchase Invoice* PDF report in the Purchase App contains multiple text formatting issues, making the document difficult to read and unprofessional in appearance. These issues include misaligned text, incorrect font sizes, overlapping fields, inconsistent spacing, and truncation of important details.

----

h3. *Precondition:*

* User is logged into the Purchase App.
* At least one *Return Purchase Invoice* exists in the system.
* The system allows exporting *Return Purchase Invoice* as a PDF.

----

h3. *Steps to Reproduce:*

# Navigate to the *Return Purchase Invoice* list view.
# Select any existing *Return Purchase Invoice*.
# Click the *Export to PDF* option.
# Open the generated PDF file and review the formatting.

----

h3. *Expected Result:*

* The PDF report should have a *clear and professional* layout.
* Text should be *properly aligned* and readable.
* Font sizes should be *consistent* throughout the document.
* Key details (invoice number, supplier, date, item list, quantities, totals) should be *clearly visible* and not truncated.
* Spacing between fields should be *uniform* and well-structured.

----

h3. *Actual Result:*

* Text is *misaligned* in several sections.
* Font sizes are *inconsistent*, with some text too small or too large.
* Some data fields are *overlapping*, making information unreadable.
* Important details (e.g., invoice numbers, supplier names) are *truncated*.
* Spacing between fields is *inconsistent*, causing a cluttered look.

----

h3. *Severity:*

*High* ? Affects usability and professional appearance of official documents.

h3. *Priority:*

*High* ? Fixing formatting issues is crucial to ensure *clear and accurate* invoice reporting.

column2: (SP21): Missing Column Filtering Functionality in the 'Return Purchase Invoice' List View
column28:
*Title:*
Missing Column Filtering Functionality in the 'Return Purchase Invoice' List View

*Description:*
In the *Return Purchase Invoice* list view screen of the Purchase App, the system does not provide column filtering functionality. Users cannot filter records based on specific columns (e.g., Invoice Number, Supplier Name, Return Date, or Status). This makes it difficult to quickly find relevant invoices, especially when managing a large number of return transactions.

----

h3. *Precondition:*

* User is logged into the Purchase App.
* Multiple *Return Purchase Invoices* exist in the system.

----

h3. *Steps to Reproduce:*

# Navigate to the *Return Purchase Invoice* list view.
# Observe the available columns (e.g., Invoice Number, Supplier, Date, Status).
# Try to apply a filter for any column (e.g., filter by a specific *Vendor Name* or *Invoice Number*).
# Notice that no filtering option is available.

----

h3. *Expected Result:*

* The list view should provide a *column filtering* functionality, allowing users to filter invoices based on attributes such as:
** *Invoice Number*
** *Vensor Name*
** *Return Date*
** *Status* (e.g., Pending, Posted, Canceled)
* Users should be able to enter search values or select from dropdowns where applicable.

----

h3. *Actual Result:*

* No *column filtering* functionality is available.
* Users must manually search for invoices, making it difficult to locate specific records.

----

h3. *Severity:*

*Medium* ? Affects usability but does not impact core functionality.

column2: (SP21): The 'Print' Button in the 'Return Purchase Invoice' List View is Not Actionable
column28:
*Title:*
The 'Print' Button in the 'Return Purchase Invoice' List View is Not Actionable

*Description:*
In the *Return Purchase Invoice* list view of the Purchase App, the *Print* button is non-functional. When a user selects a *Return Purchase Invoice* and clicks the *Print* button, no action is triggered, preventing users from printing invoices directly from the list view. This impacts the usability of the system, as users must find alternative ways to obtain a printed version of the invoice.

----

h3. *Precondition:*

* User is logged into the Purchase App.
* User has access to the *Return Purchase Invoice* module.
* At least one *Return Purchase Invoice* exists in the system.

----

h3. *Steps to Reproduce:*

# Navigate to the *Return Purchase Invoice* list view.
# Select an existing *Return Purchase Invoice* from the list.
# Click on the *Print* button.

----

h3. *Expected Result:*

* The system should generate a print preview or directly print the selected *Return Purchase Invoice*.
* A print dialog should open, allowing users to select a printer or save as a PDF.
* If there are any restrictions, an appropriate error message should be displayed.

----

h3. *Actual Result:*

* The *Print* button does not trigger any action when clicked.
* No print preview or print dialog appears.
* Users cannot print *Return Purchase Invoices* from the list view.

h3. *Severity:*

*Medium* ? This issue affects usability but does not impact core functionalities like invoice creation or posting.

h3. *Priority:*

*High* ? Printing invoices is a key feature for record-keeping and business operations, so this issue should be addressed promptly.

column2: (SP21): System Allows Posting 'Return Purchase Invoice' with a Date Before the 'Purchase Invoice' Date
column28:
*Title:*
System Allows Posting 'Return Purchase Invoice' with a Date Before the 'Purchase Invoice' Date

*Description:*
In the Purchase App, the system allows users to post a *Return Purchase Invoice* with a date that is earlier than the original *Purchase Invoice* date. This leads to logical inconsistencies in financial records, as an invoice return should not precede the purchase itself.

*Precondition:*

* User is logged into the Purchase App.
* User has access to the 'Return Purchase Invoice' functionality.
* A valid *Purchase Invoice* exists in the system.

*Steps to Reproduce:*

# Navigate to the *Return Purchase Invoice* Add Screen.
# Select an existing *Purchase Invoice* from the list.
# Enter a *Return Purchase Invoice Date* that is earlier than the selected *Purchase Invoice Date*.
# Click on the *Post* button to submit the return invoice.

*Expected Result:*

* The system should validate the *Return Purchase Invoice Date* and prevent posting if it is earlier than the corresponding *Purchase Invoice Date*.
* An appropriate error message should be displayed, such as:
_"Return Purchase Invoice date cannot be earlier than the original Purchase Invoice date."_

*Actual Result:*

* The system accepts and posts the *Return Purchase Invoice* even if its date is before the *Purchase Invoice Date*.
* This results in an illogical transaction where a return occurs before the purchase.

column2: (SP21): The 'Return Purchase Invoice' Add Screen Allows Item Deletion in the Items Table Section
column28:
*Title:*
The 'Return Purchase Invoice' Add Screen Allows Item Deletion in the Items Table Section

*Description:*
In the Purchase App, the 'Return Purchase Invoice' Add Screen contains a *Delete* action button in the Items Table section. This leads to an issue where users can delete an item line from the selected invoice. Once deleted, the item detail is lost, preventing further manipulation or recovery of the item in the return process.

*Precondition:*

* User is logged into the Purchase App.
* User has access to the 'Return Purchase Invoice' functionality.
* A purchase invoice exists with multiple items listed.

*Steps to Reproduce:*

# Navigate to the 'Return Purchase Invoice' Add Screen.
# Select an invoice from the invoice list.
# Observe that all items from the selected invoice are displayed in the Items Table section.
# Notice the *Delete* action button is present for each item row.
# Click on the *Delete* button for any item in the list.
# The item is removed from the table, and the user is unable to reselect or manipulate the item again.

*Expected Result:*

* The *Delete* action should not be available in the Items Table section of the 'Return Purchase Invoice' Add Screen.
* Items listed under the selected invoice should remain intact to prevent accidental deletion.
* Users should be able to manage and manipulate all items without losing them unintentionally.

*Actual Result:*

* The *Delete* action button is available in the Items Table section.
* Users can delete an item from the list.
* Once an item is deleted, it cannot be recovered or manipulated in the return process.

column2: (Sp21): Show/Hide Column Functionality Has Responsive Issues in Purchase Invoice List View
column28:
*Title:*
Show/Hide Column Functionality Has Responsive Issues in Purchase Invoice List View

*Description:*
In the *Purchase Invoice List View*, the *Show/Hide Columns* functionality does not work properly on standard screen resolutions. The options dialog for selecting columns *does not appear* unless the user *zooms out multiple times*, indicating a *responsive design issue*.

*Precondition:*

* User is logged into the ERP system.
* The system is displayed at default zoom level (100%).

*Steps to Reproduce:*

# Navigate to the *Purchase app > Purchase Invoice List View*.
# Click on the *Show/Hide Columns* option.
# Observe that the dialog *does not appear* at the default zoom level.
# Zoom out multiple times (e.g., 67% or lower).
# Observe that the *dialog appears* only after zooming out.

*Expected Result:*

* The *Show/Hide Columns* dialog should be properly displayed at *any screen resolution or zoom level* without requiring manual zoom adjustments.

*Actual Result:*

* The *Show/Hide Columns* dialog *does not appear* at 100% zoom.
* Users must *zoom out multiple times* to make it visible.
* This affects usability, especially for users unaware of the zoom workaround.

*Title:*
"Print" Action Button in Purchase Invoice List View Is Not Actionable and Lacks Hover Tooltip

*Description:*
In the *Purchase Invoice List View*, the *"Print"* action button under the *Actions* column is *not actionable* when clicked. Additionally, there is *no tooltip* or visual indication when hovering over the button, making it unclear whether the button is disabled or non-functional.

*Precondition:*

* User is logged into the ERP system.
* At least one *Purchase Invoice* exists in the list view.

*Steps to Reproduce:*

# Navigate to the *Purchase app > Purchase Invoice List View*.
# Locate a row with a *Purchase Invoice* entry.
# Under the *Actions* column, click the *Print* button.
# Observe that *nothing happens* when clicking the button.
# Hover over the *Print* button and observe that *no tooltip* is displayed.

*Expected Result:*

* The *Print* button should generate a printable version of the *Purchase Invoice* when clicked.
* If printing is not available for certain statuses, the button should be *disabled* with a proper tooltip explaining why.
* A hover tooltip should display a helpful message, such as *"Print Purchase Invoice"*.

*Actual Result:*

* The *Print* button is *not functional* when clicked.
* No *tooltip* is shown when hovering over the button.
* There is an error in the Network

*Steps to Reproduce:*

# Click on the *Export* button to download the report as an Excel file.
# Open the exported Excel file and review the column headers.

*Expected Result:*

* All column headers should be correctly localized according to the selected system language.

*Actual Result:*

* The localization does not match the selected system language.

column2: (Sp21): Delete and Edit Action Buttons Are Incorrectly Displayed for Posted Purchase Invoice
column28:
*Title:*
Delete and Edit Action Buttons Are Incorrectly Displayed for Posted Purchase Invoice

*Description:*
The *Delete* and *Edit* action buttons are currently visible for a *Posted Purchase Invoice*, which should not be allowed. These actions should only be available when the status is *anything other than "Posted"* to prevent unintended modifications to finalized transactions.

*Precondition:*

* User is logged into the ERP system.
* A *Purchase Invoice* has been created and successfully *Posted*.

*Steps to Reproduce:*

# Navigate to the *Purchase app > Purchase Invoice*.
# Locate a *Posted* Purchase Invoice.
# Observe that the *Delete* and *Edit* buttons are still displayed.

*Expected Result:*

* The *Delete* and *Edit* buttons should be hidden or disabled when the Purchase Invoice status is *"Posted"*.

*Actual Result:*

* The *Delete* and *Edit* buttons remain visible and active for a *Posted* Purchase Invoice, allowing potential modifications to a finalized transaction.

column2: (SP21): System Accepts Discount Amount Greater Than Cost in Purchase Invoice but Displays Incorrect Validation After Save and Post
column28:
*Title:*
System Accepts Discount Amount Greater Than Cost in Purchase Invoice but Displays Incorrect Validation After Save and Post

*Description:*
When a user inputs a discount amount greater than the cost in the Purchase Invoice, the system allows this value to be entered. However, upon clicking the "Save" button, a descriptive validation message appears, prompting the user to correct the discount amount. Once the user clears the greater discount and enters a valid value, the transaction is saved successfully. But when the user clicks the "Post" button, an undescriptive validation message is displayed with network error messages such as "Cost must be positive" and "Quantity must be positive." This behavior indicates that the system either does not correctly clear cache or does not respond properly to changes in field values.

*Precondition:*

* User is logged into the ERP system.
* The user is on the Purchase Invoice screen.
* The discount amount is entered as greater than the cost.

*Steps to Reproduce:*

# Navigate to the Purchase app > Purchase Invoice.
# Enter all required fields for the purchase invoice.
# Click Add new Line to add new item
# Select Items from the Dropdown and input valid Quantity and Cost
# Input a discount amount that is greater than the item cost.
# Click the "Save" button.
# A descriptive validation message is shown indicating the discount amount is greater than the cost.
# Correct the discount amount to a valid value and click the "Save" button again. The transaction is saved successfully.
# Click the "Post" button to try to post the transaction.

*Expected Result:*

* The discount amount should not be allowed to exceed the cost value in the first place.
* After inputting valid values and saving the transaction, the post operation should succeed without any validation errors.

*Actual Result:*

* The system allows the discount amount to exceed the cost.
* After saving, the user receives a validation message that prompts them to adjust the discount amount.
* After entering a valid discount and saving the transaction, the user encounters an undescriptive validation message when trying to post the transaction.
* The network error messages include "Cost must be positive" and "Quantity must be positive," even though the data appears to be correct.
* The system does not correctly clear cache or respond properly to field value changes, causing the undescriptive error.

column2: (SP21): "Fill Items Data with Excel" functionality not populating items in the "Add Price Policy" screen.
column28:
*Title:*
"Fill Items Data with Excel" functionality not populating items in the "Add Price Policy" screen.

*Description:*
The "Fill Items Data with Excel" feature in the "Add Price Policy" screen is not working as expected. When users upload a filled Excel template, no data is populated in the "Items Lines" section despite the success message being displayed.

*Steps to Reproduce:*

# Log in to the ERP system and navigate to the "Add Price Policy" screen.
# Click on the "Upload Excel" button to download the template.
# Fill in the required and valid data in the downloaded Excel template for relevant items.
# Save the filled Excel file.
# Upload the filled Excel file.
# After uploading, the system displays a confirmation message: "Operation completed successfully."
# However, upon checking the "Items Lines" section, no item data is populated.

*Expected Behavior:*
After uploading a valid, filled Excel template, the "Items Lines" section should automatically populate with the data from the uploaded file.

*Actual Behavior:*
Despite the success message "Operation completed successfully," no data appears in the "Items Lines" section after uploading the Excel file.

*Priority:*
High (affects the ability to upload data for price policy creation efficiently).

*Steps to Reproduce*:

column2: (SP21): Payment Out Add Screen Freezes When Payment Method Details Are Incomplete
column28:
h3. *Title: Payment Out Add Screen Freezes When Payment Method Details Are Incomplete*

----

h4. *Bug Summary*

* *Title:* Payment Out Add screen freezes and becomes unresponsive when "Payment Method Details" is incomplete.
* *Severity:* Blocker
* *Module:* Payment Out > Add Screen
* *Environment:* Web Application

----

h4. *Bug Description*

In the *Payment Out Add* screen, leaving the *Payment Method Details* field incomplete while filling in other required fields triggers the error message "Error: Payment Method Details Required In Line 1." This causes the screen to freeze, making all buttons unresponsive. The user must refresh the page, resulting in the loss of all inputted data.

----

h4. *Steps to Reproduce*

# Navigate to the *Payment Out Add* screen.
# Fill in all required fields except the *Payment Method Details* field.
# Click the *Save* button.

----

h4. *Expected Result*

* The system should display a non-disruptive validation message and allow the user to correct the error.
* Input data should remain intact after validation.

----

h4. *Actual Result*

* An error message "Error: Payment Method Details Required In Line 1" is displayed.
* The screen freezes, all buttons become unresponsive, and the user must refresh the page.
* All inputted data is lost upon refresh.

* The link does not open in a new tab or window.
* No content is loaded, and the user's action does not yield any response.

column2: SP 22 - Financial Calendar: Error Missing When Closing Year Without Posting Journal Entries.
column28:
*Description*:
In the Financial Calendar screen, when entering the date range *1/1/2026 to 2/1/2026* and attempting to close the year, no error message appears despite unposted journal entries within the specified date range. The system only saves the journal entry but does not post it, preventing proper closure of the financial calendar.

*Steps to Reproduce*:

# Navigate to the *Financial Calendar* screen.
# Enter the date range *1/1/2026 to 2/1/2026*.
# Create a journal entry with a date within this range (*e.g., 2/1/2026*) and save it without posting.
# Attempt to close the financial year using the *Close Year* option.

*Expected Result*:
An error message should appear, stating that all journal entries within the selected date range must be posted before closing the financial year.

*Actual Result*:

* The system allows the year to be closed without verifying the status of journal entries.
* No error message appears to notify the user of the unposted journal entry.

column2: (SP21): System Allows Deletion of Tax Groups Assigned to Tax Definitions
column28:
*Title:*
System Allows Deletion of Tax Groups Assigned to Tax Definitions

----

*Description:*
The system incorrectly permits the deletion of tax groups that are already assigned to tax definitions. This behavior can lead to broken references, data inconsistencies, and operational issues when processing taxes within the system.

----

*Precondition:*

* The ERP system is accessible, and the user is logged in with permissions to manage tax groups and tax definitions.
* A tax group is assigned to one or more tax definitions.

----

*Steps to Reproduce:*

# Log in to the ERP system.
# Navigate to the General Settings APP >>> *Tax Group* screen.
# Identify a tax group that is assigned to one or more tax definitions.
# Attempt to delete the tax group.

----

*Expected Result:*
The system should prevent deletion of tax groups that are assigned to tax definitions, displaying a validation error message such as:

* "This tax group cannot be deleted as it is assigned to active tax definitions."

----

*Actual Result:*
The system allows deletion of tax groups that are assigned to tax definitions without any validation, resulting in:

* Broken references in the associated tax definitions.
* Inability to process taxes that rely on the deleted tax group.

column2: (SP21) : Longitude and Latitude Not Auto-Filled After Selecting a Map Point in Address Tab
column28:
*Title:*
Longitude and Latitude Not Auto-Filled After Selecting a Map Point in Address Tab

----

*Description:*
In the *Vendor Definition Add* screen, under the *Address Tab*, selecting a point on the map does not automatically populate the *Longitude* and *Latitude* fields. This issue disrupts the workflow and requires users to manually input coordinates, which can lead to errors.

----

*Precondition:*

* The ERP system is accessible, and the user is logged in with permissions to add vendor definitions.
* The map integration is functional and visible in the *Address Tab*.

----

*Steps to Reproduce:*

# Log in to the ERP system.
# Navigate to Purchase App
# Navigate to the *Vendor Definition Add* screen.
# Open the *Address Tab*.
# Use the map to select a location point.

----

*Expected Result:*
The *Longitude* and *Latitude* fields should be automatically populated with the coordinates of the selected point on the map.

----

*Actual Result:*
The *Longitude* and *Latitude* fields remain empty after selecting a point on the map, requiring the user to manually input the coordinates.

column2: (SP21): "Show/Hide Columns" Not Actionable Due to Responsive Issues in Vender Category List View
column28:
*Title:*
"Show/Hide Columns" Not Actionable Due to Responsive Issues in Vendeo Category List View

----

*Description:*
In the *Vendeo Category List View* screen under the *Purchase* application, the "Show/Hide Columns" functionality is unresponsive due to responsive design issues. This prevents users from customizing the displayed columns, impacting their ability to view and manage data effectively.

----

*Precondition:*

* The ERP system is accessible, and the user is logged in with permissions to access the *Purchase* application.
* The user is on a device or screen resolution where responsive design issues manifest (e.g., smaller screens or resized browser windows).

----

*Steps to Reproduce:*

# Log in to the ERP system.
# Navigate to the *Purchase* module.
# Open the *Vendeo Category List View* screen.
# Attempt to use the *"Show/Hide Columns"* functionality on a device with a small screen or in a resized browser window.

----

*Expected Result:*
The "Show/Hide Columns" functionality should remain actionable and display a responsive, user-friendly interface regardless of screen size or resolution.

----

*Actual Result:*

* The "Show/Hide Columns" button is unresponsive on smaller screens or when the browser window is resized.
* The UI layout shifts in a way that either hides or disables the functionality, preventing user interaction.

column2: (SP21): Infinite Loading When Adding Customer Definition Without an Open Financial Year
column28:
*Title:*
Infinite Loading When Adding Customer Definition Without an Open Financial Year

----

*Description:*
When attempting to add a customer definition with all required fields filled but no open financial year, the system enters an infinite loading state. Upon clicking the "Save" button:

# A "Open Financial Year" popup appears in the background (bottom layer).
# An infinite loading circular progress bar is displayed in the foreground (top layer).
# No data is saved, and the user cannot proceed.

----

*Precondition:*

* The ERP system is accessible, and the user is logged in with the necessary permissions to add customer definitions.
* There is no financial year opened in the system.

----

*Steps to Reproduce:*

# Log in to the ERP system.
# Navigate to the *Customer Definition Add* form.
# Fill in all required fields in the form.
# Ensure there is no open financial year in the system.
# Click the *"Save"* button.

----

*Expected Result:*
A clear and actionable message should be displayed, such as:

* Informing the user that no financial year is open.
* Providing a button or option to resolve the issue (e.g., open a financial year or contact admin).
The save operation should not trigger an infinite loading state.

----

*Actual Result:*

* A "Open Financial Year" popup appears in the background (bottom layer).
* An infinite circular progress bar is displayed in the foreground (top layer), making the system appear stuck.
* No customer data is saved, and the user cannot exit or proceed without refreshing the page.

column2: (SP21): "IsDetail" Switch Component Not Actionable on Empty Item Category Tree Screen
column28:
*Title:*
"IsDetail" Switch Component Not Actionable on Empty Item Category Add Screen

----

*Description:*
When accessing the "Item Category Add" screen under the Inventory module of the ERP system, the "IsDetail" switch component becomes unresponsive when the category tree has no saved data (i.e., the tree is empty). This issue prevents users from toggling the switch, hindering further actions on the screen.

----

*Precondition:*

* The ERP system is accessible, and the user is logged in with appropriate permissions to add item categories.
* The item category tree is empty (no categories have been saved).

----

*Steps to Reproduce:*

# Log in to the ERP system.
# Navigate to the *Inventory* module.
# Open the *Item Category Add* screen.
# Ensure the category tree is empty (no saved categories).
# Attempt to toggle the "IsDetail" switch component.

----

*Expected Result:*
1. The "IsDetail" switch should be actionable regardless of whether the category tree has saved data or is empty, allowing the user to toggle it freely.

# The screen is responsive and all the buttons are actionable

----

*Actual Result:*
1. The "IsDetail" switch is unresponsive and cannot be toggled when the category tree is empty, preventing the user from proceeding.

# The All Buttons (Save - Cancel) are not actionable

column2: (SP20) Treasury: Localization Issues in Column Headers of Exported PDF/Excel Reports
column28:
*Title:*
Localization Issues in Column Headers of Exported PDF/Excel Reports

*Description:*
When generating PDF or Excel reports through the export functionality, the column headers are not localized and appear in the default language (e.g., English) instead of the selected language or localization settings configured by the user. This behavior leads to inconsistencies between the system's display language and the exported report content.

*Steps to Reproduce:*

# Log in to the system and change the language or localization settings to a non-default language (e.g., Arabic, English, etc.).
# Navigate to any module that supports export functionality (e.g., Treasury).
# Generate a report by clicking the *Export to PDF* or *Export to Excel* button.
# Open the exported report and observe the column headers.

*Expected Result:*

* The column headers in the exported PDF/Excel reports should reflect the language and localization settings selected by the user.

*Actual Result:*

* The column headers are not well localized or translated.

column2: (SP20) @General: Export Button Does Not Display Informative Message When List View Is Empty
column28:
*Title:*
Export Button Does Not Display Informative Message When List View Is Empty

*Description:*
When the *Export* button is clicked in a list view that has no data (i.e., the list is empty), the system performs no action and does not display any informative message to the user. This behavior creates confusion as users are unaware that the export operation cannot proceed due to the absence of data.

*Steps to Reproduce:*

# Navigate to a list view in the module where the *Export* functionality is available.
# Ensure the list view is empty (e.g., by applying filters that return no results or by having no saved data).
# Click the *Export* button.

*Expected Result:*

* The system should display an informative message, such as:
_"No data available to export. Please ensure there are records in the list view before attempting to export."_
* The export operation should be prevented when the list view is empty.

*Actual Result:*

* No action is performed upon clicking the *Export* button.
* No message or feedback is provided to inform the user about the empty list view.

*Severity:*
Medium

column2: (SP20) Treasury Edit Screen: Column Filtering in Select JL Account Advanced Dialog Allows User to Select Account Without Viewing Details
column28:
*Title:*
Column Filtering in Select JL Account Advanced Dialog Allows User to Select Account Without Viewing Details

*Description:*
In the *Select JL Account Advanced Dialog*, accessed via the *Edit Treasury* dialog, the column filtering functionality allows users to uncheck all columns except the *Actions* column. This behavior makes it possible for users to select a JL account without being able to view its corresponding details or information, leading to confusion and potential data integrity issues.

*Steps to Reproduce:*

# Navigate to the *Treasury List View*.
# Select a treasury and open the *Edit Treasury* dialog.
# Click the *Advanced Search* icon for the JL Account field to open the *Select JL Account Advanced Dialog*.
# Use the column filtering options to uncheck all columns except the *Actions* column.
# Attempt to select a JL account without viewing its details.

*Expected Result:*

* Users should not be able to uncheck all essential columns that display critical information (e.g., account name, Code, or description).
* A validation mechanism should ensure that key columns remain visible to prevent ambiguous or uninformed account selection.

*Actual Result:*

* The *Actions* column remains the only visible column after unchecking all other columns.
* Users can select a JL account without seeing any additional details or information about the account.

*Severity:*
High

column2: (SP20): Treasury Statement Fails to Display Opening Balance for Treasuries with No Transactions
column28:
*Title:*
Treasury Statement Fails to Display Opening Balance for Treasuries with No Transactions

*Description:*
When a user generates a *Treasury Statement* for a treasury with no transactions and applies a valid date range using the *From Date* and *To Date* filters, the opening balance is not displayed. Additionally, no informative message is shown to indicate the absence of transactions or opening balance, which creates confusion for the user.

*Steps to Reproduce:*

# Navigate to the *Treasury Statement* screen.
# Select a treasury with no transactions recorded.
# Set a valid *From Date* and *To Date* filter.
# Click on the *Generate Report* button.
# Observe the generated statement.

*Expected Result:*

* The Treasury Statement should display the opening balance, even if no transactions are present during the selected date range.
* If the treasury has no opening balance or transactions, the system should display an informative message such as:
"No transactions available for the selected date range. The opening balance is [0 or X amount]."

*Actual Result:*

* The Treasury Statement does not display any opening balance.
* No informative message is provided, leaving the user uncertain about the state of the treasury.

*Severity:*
Medium

column2: SP 21 - Barcode and Field Behavior in Item Definition: Barcode Disappears and Field Data Misalignment
column28:
*Description*:
In the *Item Definition* screen, the *Barcode* field disappears when clicking on other fields. Additionally, the *Item Code* field incorrectly displays the item description, while the *Item Description* field displays the item code. This misalignment creates confusion and impacts user experience.

*Steps to Reproduce*:

# Navigate to the *Item Definition* screen.
# Enter data in the *Barcode* field and then click on another field.
# Observe the *Barcode* field behavior.
# Check the data displayed in the *Item Code* and *Item Description* fields.

*Expected Result*:

* The *Barcode* field should retain its value even after navigating to other fields.
* The *Item Code* field should display the *code* of the item.
* The *Item Description* field should display the *description* of the item.

*Actual Result*:

* The *Barcode* field disappears when clicking on other fields.
* The *Item Code* field displays the *description* instead of the code.
* The *Item Description* field displays the *code* instead of the description.

column2: SP 21 - Financial Calendar: Success Message for Row Deletion Needs to Be Handled
column28:
*Description*:
In the *Financial Calendar* screen, when a row is deleted from the list, the success message displayed is generic or unclear. The message should explicitly indicate that the row was deleted successfully to enhance user clarity and experience.

*Steps to Reproduce*:

# Navigate to the *Financial Calendar* screen.
# Select a row in the list to delete.
# Click the *Delete* button.
# Observe the success message displayed after the deletion.

A clear and specific success message should appear, such as: "The selected row has been deleted successfully."

column2: SP 21 - Journal Entry Opening Balance: Branch Field Displays Required Error Message Despite Existing Value
column28:
*Description*:
In the *Journal Entry Opening Balance* screen, the *Branch* field incorrectly displays a required error message even when a value is already provided. This behavior prevents users from proceeding with the operation.

*Steps to Reproduce*:

# Navigate to the *Journal Entry Opening Balance* screen.
# Fill in the *Branch* field with a valid value.
# Attempt to save the entry.

*Expected Result*:
The system should accept the valid value in the *Branch* field without displaying a required error message.

*Actual Result*:
A required error message is displayed for the *Branch* field, despite it being filled with a valid value.

column2: (SP20):  Unresponsive Save Buttons and Screen Freeze in Edit Treasury Form
column28:
*Title:*
Save Buttons Become Unresponsive and Screen Freezes on Edit Treasury Form

*Description:*
In the Edit Treasury form, when a user fills all required fields correctly and clicks the *Save* button, the system displays an inner scroll bar within the save buttons. All buttons become non-actionable, and the screen status freezes, preventing further interaction.

*Steps to Reproduce:*

# Navigate to the Treasury module in the system.
# Open the *Edit Treasury* form for any existing treasury record.
# Fill in all required fields correctly.
# *Change the Treasury Opening Balance Value*
# Click the *Save* button.
# Observe the behavior of the save buttons and the screen.

*Expected Result:*

* The form should save the data successfully without introducing a scroll bar inside the save buttons.
* The buttons should remain actionable.
* The screen should remain responsive, allowing further user interaction.

*Actual Result:*

* A scroll bar appears inside the save buttons.
* All buttons become unresponsive.
* The screen status freezes, and no further action can be performed.

*Severity:*
Critical

column28:
*Title:*
System Fails to Delete Sub UOMs in Edit Screen Despite Displaying Success Message

*Description:*
In the Unit of Measure (UOM) Edit screen, when a user attempts to delete Sub UOMs that have not been used in any transactions or master data, the system displays a success message after confirmation. However, the Sub UOMs remain visible in the Edit screen even after multiple page refreshes.

*Precondition:*

There is a saved UOM that has many related sub UOMS

*Steps to Reproduce:*

# Navigate to the Inventory app.
# Open the UOM Edit screen.
# Delete one or more Sub UOMs by clicking the "Delete" button next to them.
# Confirm the delete action in the confirmation dialog.
# Refresh the UOM Edit screen multiple times.

*Expected Result:*
The deleted Sub UOMs should be successfully removed from the Edit screen and not appear again after the system displays the success message.

*Actual Result:*
The system displays a success message indicating that the Sub UOMs were deleted. However, the Sub UOMs remain visible in the Edit screen even after refreshing the page multiple times.

*Severity:*
High

column2: Inventory opening balance Bugs
(SP20) Attribute Edit Screen: System Does Not Return to List View After Successful Editing
column28:
*Title:*
System Fails to Redirect to List View After Successful Editing in Attribute Edit Screen

*Description:*
After successfully editing an attribute in the Inventory app's Attribute Edit screen, the system does not redirect the user back to the List view. Instead, the user remains on the Edit screen, causing confusion about whether the operation was successful.

*Steps to Reproduce:*

# Navigate to the Inventory app.
# Open the Attribute List view.
# Select an attribute and click the "Edit" button.
# Make valid changes to the attribute fields.
# Click the "Save" button.

*Expected Result:*
The system should display a success message and redirect the user back to the Attribute List view.

*Actual Result:*
The system displays a success message but does not redirect the user back to the Attribute List view.

*Severity:*

column2: (SP20) Attribute Edit Screen: Missing Required Validation Messages
column28:
*Title:*
Missing Required Validation Messages After Clicking Save with Empty Required Fields

*Description:*
When a user clears the required fields and clicks the "Save" button on the Attribute Edit screen, the system does not display validation messages to inform the user of missing required data. This prevents the user from understanding why the operation cannot proceed.

*Steps to Reproduce:*

# Navigate to the Inventory app.
# Open the Attribute List view and select an attribute to edit.
# Clear all required fields (e.g., Attribute Name, Value).
# Click the "Save" button.

*Expected Result:*
The system should display clear validation messages under or near the required fields, indicating that they need to be filled.

*Actual Result:*
The system does not display any validation messages, leaving the user unaware of the missing data.

*Severity:*
High

column2: (SP20) Attribute Edit Screen: Save Button Infinite Loading and Unresponsive Components
column28:
*Title:*
Save Button Shows Infinite Loading and Becomes Unresponsive After Deleting All Value Lines

*Description:*
On the Attribute Edit screen, if the user deletes all value lines and then clicks the "Save" button, the button displays an infinite loading icon, changes its shape, and becomes unresponsive. Additionally, the screen components become non-actionable, requiring a page refresh to recover functionality.

*Steps to Reproduce:*

# Navigate to the Inventory app.
# Open the Attribute List view and select an attribute to edit.
# Delete all value lines from the attribute.
# Click the "Save" button.

*Expected Result:*
The system should display a validation message stating that at least one value line is required and allow the user to continue editing.

*Actual Result:*
The "Save" button shows an infinite loading icon, changes its shape, and becomes unresponsive. The entire screen's components are non-actionable, and functionality is only restored after refreshing the page.

*Severity:*
Critical

column2: (SP20): Profile Link Not Actionable in Business Owner Screen
column28:
h3. *Title: Profile Link Not Actionable in Business Owner Screen*

*Project/Module:* ERP System ? Business Owner Screen
*Severity:* High

----

h3. *Issue Description*

The "Profile" link in the Business Owner screen is not actionable. Clicking the link does not navigate to the profile details page or trigger any response, rendering it non-functional.

----

h3. *Steps to Reproduce*

# Log in to the Business Owner screen.
# Locate the "Profile" link in the top-right corner.
# Attempt to click the "Profile" link.
# Observe the system's behavior.

----

h3. *Expected Behavior*

Clicking the "Profile" link should redirect the user to the Profile details page or open the profile management view, allowing the user to update their information.

----

h3. *Actual Behavior*

The "Profile" link does not respond to user interaction. No redirection, action, or feedback occurs upon clicking the link.

column2: (SP20): Dark Mode Not Applying in Business Owner Screen

h3. *Title: Dark Mode Not Applying in Business Owner Screen*

*Project/Module:* ERP System ? Business Owner Screen
*Severity:* Medium

----

The Business Owner screen does not switch to Dark Mode when the user selects the Dark Mode option. This issue persists even though the rest of the system successfully applies the Dark Mode setting.

----

# Log in to the Business Owner screen.
# Open the system's appearance settings.
# Select the Dark Mode option.
# Observe whether the Business Owner screen updates to Dark Mode.

----

h3. *Expected Behavior*

The Business Owner screen should switch to Dark Mode immediately upon selecting the option, consistent with other screens in the system.

----

h3. *Actual Behavior*

The Business Owner screen remains in Light Mode, ignoring the user's selection of Dark Mode.

column2: (SP20): Language and Localization Not Changing in Business Owner Screen

h3. *Title: Language and Localization Not Changing in Business Owner Screen*

*Project/Module:* ERP System ? Business Owner Screen
*Severity:* Medium

----

h3. *Issue Description*

The Business Owner screen does not update its language and localization settings when the user attempts to change them. This issue persists despite successfully changing the language settings in other parts of the system.

----

# Log in to the Business Owner screen.
# Attempt to change the language and localization settings through the system's language selector.
# Observe whether the screen reflects the updated language and localization settings.

----

h3. *Expected Behavior*

The Business Owner screen should update its language and localization settings to match the selected language immediately or upon refresh, similar to other screens in the system.

----

h3. *Actual Behavior*

The Business Owner screen remains in the default language, ignoring the user's selected language and localization preferences.

column2: (SP20): Missing field with Tax Label and Applied Tax value in Add Invoice and Invoice Payment screens
column28:
*Title:*
Missing field with Tax Label and Applied Tax value in Add Invoice and Invoice Payment screens

*Description:*
Both the *Add Invoice* and *Invoice Payment* screens are missing a field that displays the *Tax Label* and the *Applied Tax* value. This missing information prevents users from clearly seeing the tax applied to the invoice, leading to confusion and potential errors in payment processing.

*Precondition:*

# The user is logged into the admin portal.
# The user is on the *Add Invoice* or *Invoice Payment* screen.
# The invoice includes taxable items, and tax has been applied.

*Steps to Reproduce:*

# Log in to the admin portal as an authorized user.
# Navigate to the *Add Invoice* or *Invoice Payment* screen.
# Create or load an invoice that includes taxable items.
# Check for the field displaying the *Tax Label* and *Applied Tax* value.

*Expected Result:*

# There should be a clear and visible field on both screens displaying the *Tax Label* (e.g., "VAT") and the *Applied Tax* value (e.g., "15%").
# The field should reflect the correct tax value applied to the invoice based on the taxable items.

*Actual Result:*

# The field with the *Tax Label* and *Applied Tax* value is missing on both the *Add Invoice* and *Invoice Payment* screens.
# Users are unable to see the tax applied to the invoice, which may lead to confusion during the payment process.

column2: (SP20): Required validation messages in (CMS Add/Edit Screen) are displayed in black color font, making them hard to distinguish
column28:
*Title:*
Required validation messages in  (CMS Add/ Edit Screens)are displayed in black color font, making them hard to distinguish

*Description:*
The required validation messages in the *CMS Management* section are displayed in black color font, which makes them difficult to see, especially when the background or surrounding elements are dark. This affects the usability of the system, as users may miss critical validation feedback when filling out forms.

*Precondition:*

# The user is on the *CMS Management* screen.
# A required field is left empty or invalid in the CMS form.

*Steps to Reproduce:*

# Log in to the admin portal as an authorized user.
# Navigate to the *CMS Management* section.
# Attempt to save a new CMS entry without filling in all the required fields.
# Observe the validation messages displayed for the missing or incorrect fields.

*Expected Result:*

# Validation messages should be displayed in a color that contrasts clearly with the background, such as red or another easily distinguishable color.
# The messages should be easy to see and should draw attention to the user that a required field is missing or invalid.

*Actual Result:*

# The required validation messages are displayed in black font.
# The messages are difficult to distinguish, especially if the background or surrounding elements are dark in color.

column2: (SP20): System cannot delete the saved CMS; returns status code 405 without a descriptive message
column28:
*Title:*
System cannot delete the saved CMS; returns status code 405 without a descriptive message

*Description:*
When attempting to delete a saved CMS entry, the system fails to perform the operation and returns a status code 405. The user is not provided with a descriptive error message explaining the failure, resulting in confusion and the inability to take corrective action.

*Precondition:*

# The user is logged into the admin portal.
# A CMS entry is already saved in the system.
# The user has sufficient permissions to delete CMS entries.

*Steps to Reproduce:*

# Log in to the admin portal as an authorized user.
# Navigate to the *CMS Management* section.
# Locate a saved CMS entry in the list.
# Click the *Delete* button for the selected CMS entry.
# Observe the system?s response and behavior.

*Expected Result:*

# The CMS entry should be deleted successfully, with the system returning a confirmation message (e.g., "CMS entry deleted successfully").
# If the deletion fails, the system should display a descriptive error message (e.g., "Deletion failed: HTTP method not allowed. Please contact support.").

*Actual Result:*

# The system fails to delete the CMS entry and returns a status code 405.
# No descriptive error message is displayed to the user.
# The CMS entry remains in the list.

column2: (SP20): Missing tooltips on "Proceed to Offline Payment" and "Proceed to Online Payment" buttons
column28:
*Title:*
Missing tooltips on "Proceed to Offline Payment" and "Proceed to Online Payment" buttons

*Description:*
The *Invoice Payment* screen is missing tooltips for the *"Proceed to Offline Payment"* and *"Proceed to Online Payment"* buttons. Tooltips provide additional guidance to users about the purpose and functionality of these buttons, enhancing the user experience and reducing confusion.

*Precondition:*

# The user is on the *Invoice Payment* screen with an unpaid invoice.
# The *"Proceed to Offline Payment"* and *"Proceed to Online Payment"* buttons are visible and actionable.

*Steps to Reproduce:*

# Log in to the admin portal as a user.
# Navigate to the *Invoice Payment* screen.
# Hover over the *"Proceed to Offline Payment"* button.
# Hover over the *"Proceed to Online Payment"* button.

*Expected Result:*
Tooltips should appear when hovering over the buttons:

* *Proceed to Offline Payment*: "Click to pay the invoice through offline payment methods such as bank transfer or cash."
* *Proceed to Online Payment*: "Click to pay the invoice through an online payment gateway using Visa, MasterCard, or other online payment methods."

*Actual Result:*
No tooltips are displayed when hovering over either button, leaving users without additional guidance.

column2: (SP20): System enables multiple success payment operations upon repeated clicks of "Proceed to Offline Payment" and "Proceed to Online Payment" Buttons
column28:
*Title:*
System enables multiple success payment operations upon repeated clicks of "Proceed to Offline Payment" and "Proceed to Online Payment" Buttons

*Description:*
When the user clicks the *"Proceed to Offline Payment"* button, the system displays a success confirmation message. However, the *Invoice Payment* screen remains open with the *"Proceed to Offline Payment"* and *"Proceed to Online Payment"* buttons still actionable. This allows users to repeatedly perform the payment operation, resulting in multiple success confirmation messages and potentially duplicate payments.

*Precondition:*

# The user is on the *Invoice Payment* screen with an unpaid invoice.
# Both *"Proceed to Offline Payment"* and *"Proceed to Online Payment"* buttons are enabled.

*Steps to Reproduce:*

# Log in to the admin portal as a user.
# Navigate to the *Invoice Payment* screen.
# Click the *"Proceed to Offline Payment"* button.
# Observe the success confirmation message.
# From the *Invoice Payment* screen and click the *"Proceed to Offline Payment"* button again.
# Repeat the process and observe multiple success confirmation messages.
# From the *Invoice Payment* screen and click the *"Proceed to Online Payment"* button.
# Complete Payment process with Correct Visa information.

*Expected Result:*

# After a successful offline payment, the system should disable the *"Proceed to Offline Payment"* and *"Proceed to Online Payment"* buttons for the invoice.
# The user should be redirected to a confirmation page or the payment screen should update to reflect the payment status (e.g., marked as paid).
# Multiple payment operations should be prevented for the same invoice.

*Actual Result:*

# The success confirmation message is displayed after each click on the *"Proceed to Offline Payment"* button.
# The *Invoice Payment* screen remains open, with both payment buttons still actionable.
# Multiple success payment operations are allowed, causing confusion and potential duplicate payments.

column2: (SP20): Missing descriptive validation error when clicking "Proceed to Offline Payment" with an incorrectly formatted password
column28:
*Title:*
Missing descriptive validation error when clicking "Proceed to Offline Payment" with an incorrectly formatted password

*Description:*
When clicking the *"Proceed to Offline Payment"* button, if the user inputs a password that does not match the required format, no clear or descriptive validation error is displayed. This leaves the user unaware of why the action cannot proceed, despite all other required fields being filled correctly.

*Precondition:*

# The user is on the *Offline Payment* screen.
# All required fields are correctly filled, except the password field, which contains an invalid format.

*Steps to Reproduce:*

# Log in to the admin portal as a user.
# Navigate to the *Offline Payment* screen.
# Fill in all required fields with valid inputs except for the password, which should not meet the format requirements (e.g., missing special characters or required length).
# Click the *"Proceed to Offline Payment"* button.
# Observe the validation behavior and error message (if any).

*Expected Result:*
A clear and descriptive validation error should appear, indicating the exact password format requirements (e.g., "Password must be at least 8 characters long and include a mix of uppercase, lowercase, numbers, and special characters.").

*Actual Result:*
No clear or descriptive validation error is displayed. The user cannot proceed but is not informed of the reason, leading to confusion.

column2: (SP20): Search functionality not working in the Invoice List
column28:
*Title:*
Search functionality not working in the Invoice List

*Description:*
The *Search functionality* in the *Invoice List* does not return relevant or expected results. When attempting to search for invoices using criteria like invoice number, customer name, or date, the results are inaccurate or the search fails entirely.

*Precondition:*

# The admin user has access to the *Invoice List* screen.
# There are multiple invoices listed in the system.

*Steps to Reproduce:*

# Log in to the admin portal as an admin user.
# Navigate to *Invoices* > *List View*.
# Use the search bar to search for an invoice using:
#* Code
#* Business Owner Name
#* InvoiceDate
# Observe the search results.

*Expected Result:*
The search functionality should return a filtered list of invoices that match the search criteria.

*Actual Result:*

# The search functionality does not return relevant or accurate results.
# In some cases, no results are returned even when matching invoices exist.
# Searching by specific criteria (e.g., date) may not be supported or functional.

column2: (SP20): Invoice List lacks View and Edit action buttons for unpaid invoices
column28:
*Title:*
Invoice List lacks View and Edit action buttons for unpaid invoices

*Description:*
The *Invoice List* does not display the *View* and *Edit* action buttons for unpaid invoices. This prevents users from viewing the details of an unpaid invoice or making edits if necessary.

*Precondition:*

# The admin user has access to the *Invoice List* screen.
# There are unpaid invoices present in the system.

*Steps to Reproduce:*

# Log in to the admin portal as an admin user.
# Navigate to *Invoices* > *List View*.
# Locate an unpaid invoice in the list.
# Check the actions available for the unpaid invoice.

*Expected Result:*
Unpaid invoices should have *View* and *Edit* action buttons to allow the user to view details or make modifications.

*Actual Result:*
The *View* and *Edit* action buttons are missing for unpaid invoices, leaving no way to view or edit these invoices directly from the list.

column2: (SP20): Multiple un-understandable errors occur when sending an invoice with Some Empty Required Fields
column28:
*Title:*
Multiple errors occur when sending an invoice after creating a new business owner

*Description:*
When creating a new business owner, missing some required information, and specifying a price for the subdomain only, clicking the *Send Invoice* button triggers a *network error* and un-understandable  multiple error pop-ups. These include:

# *Error:* "The dto field is required."
# *Error:* A message with unintelligible or unclear content.
# *Error:* "Fluent Validation Error."

*Precondition:*

# The admin user has access to the *Business Owners* section.
# A new business owner is being created with all required fields filled.
# A price is entered for the subdomain field only.

*Steps to Reproduce:*

# Log in to the admin portal as an admin user.
# Navigate to *Business Owners* > *Add New*
# After Adding the *Business Owner* click the *Manage Button* on it.
# *Do not Choose a currency*
# Add *a price for the subdomain field only and leave other pricing fields empty.*
# Add *a Price for A License such as ?Basic?* 

# Click the *Send Invoice* button.
# Observe the errors that appear and the network behavior.

*Expected Result:*

# Understandable and Informative Validation message should be displayed
# The System does not send any Invoice
# The System still in the Add Invoice Screen 

*Actual Result:*

# A *network error* is triggered, and the invoice is not sent.
# Multiple error pop-ups appear:
#* *Error:* "The dto field is required."
#* A second error with an unintelligible or unclear content message.
#* *Error:* "Fluent Validation Error."

column2: (SP20): App side slider menu does not collapse or expand when clicking the toggler icon
column28:
*Title:*
App side slider menu does not collapse or expand when clicking the toggler icon

*Description:*
The *App side slider menu* fails to respond to user actions. When clicking the *App Side Toggler Icon Button*, the menu does not collapse or expand as expected. This issue prevents users from navigating effectively within the app interface.

*Precondition:*

# The admin user is logged in and has access to the app interface.
# The App side slider menu and toggler icon are visible on the screen.

*Steps to Reproduce:*

# Log in to the admin portal as an admin user.
# Navigate to a section where the *App side slider menu* is available.
# Click the *App Side Toggler Icon Button*.
# Observe the behavior of the side slider menu.

*Expected Result:*
The *App side slider menu* should collapse when clicking the toggler icon if it is expanded, and expand when clicking the toggler icon if it is collapsed.

*Actual Result:*
The *App side slider menu* remains static and does not collapse or expand when the toggler icon is clicked.

column2: (SP20): Logo Icon does not redirect to the Home screen and opens an empty web page
column28:
*Title*: Logo Icon does not redirect to the Home screen and opens an empty web page

*Description:*
Clicking on the *MicroTec Logo Icon* does not redirect the user to the *Home screen*. Instead, it opens an empty web page. The URL associated with the logo appears to be incorrect and needs adjustment to redirect to the intended *Home screen*.

*Precondition:*

# The admin user has access to the portal.

*Steps to Reproduce:*

# Log in to the admin portal as an admin user.

column2: (SP20): Incorrect search functionality in the Business Owners List View
column28:
*Title:*
Incorrect search functionality in the Business Owners List View

*Description:*
The search functionality in the *Business Owners List View* does not return accurate or expected results. When a search is conducted using specific criteria (e.g., business name, owner name, etc.), the results are either incorrect or incomplete, making it difficult for users to find the relevant business owners.

*Precondition:*

# The admin user has access to the *Business Owners List View*.
# There are multiple business owners listed in the system.

*Steps to Reproduce:*

# Log in to the admin portal as an admin user.
# Navigate to *Business Owners* > *List View*.
# Use the search bar to search for a specific business owner or business name.
# Observe the results returned by the search.

*Expected Result:*
The search functionality should return a list of business owners matching the search criteria, displaying the relevant business name or owner name.

*Actual Result:*
The search results do not match the criteria, show incomplete results.

column2: (SP20): System does not send the invoice link to the receiver's phone number via SMS
column28:
*Title:*
System does not send the invoice link to the receiver's phone number via SMS

*Description:*
The system fails to send the *Invoice Link* to the receiver?s phone number via SMS after an invoice is generated and ready to be shared. This results in the recipient not receiving the link to view or complete payment for the invoice.

*Precondition:*

# The admin user has successfully created and generated an invoice.
# The receiver?s phone number is correctly registered in the system.
# The system is configured to send SMS notifications for invoices.

*Steps to Reproduce:*

# Log in to the admin portal as an admin user.
# Create and generate an invoice for a business owner.
# Ensure the receiver's phone number is correctly entered and registered.
# Confirm that the invoice is marked for SMS delivery.
# Check if the invoice link is sent to the receiver's phone number via SMS.

*Expected Result:*
The system should send an SMS containing the invoice link to the receiver?s phone number.

*Actual Result:*
The system does not send the invoice link via SMS to the receiver?s phone number.

column1: **** 15/Jan/25 5:03 PM;712020:ae3212cd-e1d6-4083-bc70-ddd6dfebfad6;Add - Edit.png;https://microtec.atlassian.net/rest/api/3/attachment/content/15185 **** 15/Jan/25 5:02 PM;712020:ae3212cd-e1d6-4083-bc70-ddd6dfebfad6;Edit -- ADD.mp4;https://microtec.atlassian.net/rest/api/3/attachment/content/15184 **** 15/Jan/25 5:02 PM;712020:ae3212cd-e1d6-4083-bc70-ddd6dfebfad6;unexpecter redirection buttons behaviors in Buseness owner Screen.mp4;https://microtec.atlassian.net/rest/api/3/attachment/content/15186 ****  ****  ****  ****
column2: (SP20): Unexpected redirection behaviors of Action Icon buttons in the Business Owners screen
column28:
*Title:*
Unexpected redirection behaviors of buttons in the Business Owners screen

*Description:*
The buttons on the *Business Owners* screen exhibit incorrect redirection behaviors:

* The *Statement Icon* button navigates to the *Add Invoice* screen instead of the *Statement* screen.
* The *Manage* button navigates to the *Statement* screen instead of the *Business Owner Management* screen.

*Precondition:*

# The admin user has access to the admin portal.
# The user navigates to the *Business Owners* screen.

*Steps to Reproduce:*

# Log in to the admin portal as an admin user.
# Navigate to the *Business Owners* section.
# Click the *Statement Icon* button for any listed business owner.
# Observe the screen navigated to.
# Click the *Manage* button for the same business owner.
# Observe the screen navigated to.

*Expected Result:*

# The *Statement Icon* button should navigate to the *Statement* screen, displaying the financial statements for the selected business owner.
# The *Manage* button should navigate to the *Business Owner Management* screen, allowing the admin to manage the selected business owner.

*Actual Result:*

# The *Statement Icon* button navigates to the *Add Invoice* screen.
# The *Manage* button navigates to the *Statement* screen.

column2: (SP20): No redirection option after successful payment of the invoice
column28:
*Title:* No redirection option after successful payment of the invoice

*Description:*
After a user completes registration and successfully pays the invoice via Visa, the system displays a screen with a *Success* label and a green background. However, there is no confirmation screen providing additional details or an option to redirect the user to continue the login process.

*Precondition:*

# The user has received the invoice via email and paid it successfully using a Visa card.
# The payment gateway confirms the payment as successful.

*Steps to Reproduce:*

# Complete the registration process as a user.
# Receive the invoice via email and pay it using a Visa card.
# Observe the screen displayed after successful payment.

*Expected Result:*

# A confirmation screen should be displayed, showing details such as payment success, invoice details, and a success message.
# The screen should include an option to redirect the user to the login page or proceed with the next step in the process.

*Actual Result:*

# The screen shows only a *Success* label with a green background.
# No options are provided to redirect the user to the login page or continue with the process.
