column2: (SP20): App Checkboxes Not Clearly Visible Leading to Uncalculated Costs in Invoice
column28:
*Title:*
App Checkboxes Not Clearly Visible in Invoice Creation Process

*Description:*
When the admin creates an invoice, the checkboxes for selecting apps are not clearly visible. This may result in the admin unintentionally missing some app selections, causing those apps to be excluded from the invoice. Consequently, the Preview Invoice and the confirmation email ("Complete your Registration") do not reflect the correct app costs, leading to incorrect invoice totals and missing cost breakdowns.

----

h3. *Precondition:*

* The admin user has access to the admin portal.
* Apps are available for selection with prices greater than 0.

----

h3. *Steps to Reproduce:*

# Log in to the admin portal as an admin user.
# Navigate to *Business Owners > Select A Business Owner > Click Add Invoice Icon Button*.
# Attempt to select all available apps from the list (observe the visibility of checkboxes).
# Generate the invoice and preview it.
# Submit the invoice and verify the confirmation email ("Complete your Registration").

----

h3. *Expected Result:*

# The checkboxes for app selection should be clearly visible and actionable.
# The Preview Invoice should accurately display the selected apps and their associated costs.
# The confirmation email should include a detailed cost breakdown and the correct total.

----

h3. *Actual Result:*

# Checkboxes for app selection are faint or blend into the background, making them difficult to identify.
# Some apps may not be selected due to checkbox visibility issues, resulting in missing costs in the Preview Invoice.
# The confirmation email omits app costs and shows an incorrect total.

----

column2: (SP20): Valid Till field displays incorrect date in the Add Invoice section
column28:
*Title:*
Valid Till field displays incorrect date in the Add Invoice section

*Description:*
In the *Add Invoice* section under *Business Owners*, the *Valid Till* field incorrectly displays a date calculated as today's date  one year. The expected behavior is for the *Valid Till* field to display the *Invoice Date  one year*.

*Precondition:*

# The admin user has access to the admin portal.
# The user navigates to the *Add Invoice* section under *Business Owners*.
# An invoice date is selected or auto-filled.

*Steps to Reproduce:*

# Log in to the admin portal as an admin user.
# Navigate to *Business Owners* > *Add Invoice*.
# Observe the *Valid Till* field after the invoice date is selected or auto-filled.

*Expected Result:*
The *Valid Till* field should display the date calculated as *Invoice Date  one year*.

*Actual Result:*
The *Valid Till* field displays the date calculated as *today?s date  one year*, ignoring the invoice date.

column2: (SP20): Incorrect title displayed on the Business Owners screen
column28:
*Title:*
Incorrect title displayed on the Business Owners screen

*Description:*
The title of the *Business Owners* screen is incorrect, which may lead to user confusion or misinterpretation of the screen?s purpose.

*Precondition:*

# The admin user has access to the admin portal.
# The user navigates to the *Business Owners* section.

*Steps to Reproduce:*

# Log in to the admin portal as an admin user.
# Navigate to the *Business Owners* section.
# Observe the title displayed at the top of the screen.

*Expected Result:*
The title should clearly indicate the purpose of the screen, such as "Business Owners List" or "Manage Business Owners."

*Actual Result:*
The screen displays an incorrect or ambiguous title (?JournalEntry. JournalEntryList?) that does not align with the intended functionality.

column2: (SP20): Localization issues in the Manage Business Owners screen
column28:
*Title:*
Localization issues in the Manage Business Owners screen

*Description:*
The *Manage Business Owners* screen contains localization issues where text is not displayed correctly or appears in the wrong language, creating confusion for users accessing the screen in different locales.

*Precondition:*

# The admin user has access to the admin portal.
# The portal is set to a specific language (e.g., non-English) where localization should be applied.

*Steps to Reproduce:*

# Log in to the admin portal as an admin user.
# Navigate to the *Business Owners* section.
# Open the *List View* screen.
# Click the *Manage* button under a subdomain for any listed business owner.
# Review the text elements on the *Manage Business Owners* screen.

*Expected Result:*
All text elements on the screen should be displayed in the selected language with accurate translations and formatting.

*Actual Result:*

# Some text remains in English despite the selected language.
# Certain text elements are missing translations and appear as placeholders (e.g., {{{{key_not_found}}}}).
# Grammar and formatting errors in the translated text reduce readability.

column2: (SP20): Domains Button in Manage Business Owners screen is not actionable
column28:
*Title:*
Domains Button in Manage Business Owners screen is not actionable

*Description:*
On the *Manage Business Owners* screen accessed via the *List View* in the admin portal, the *Domains Button* is not actionable, preventing further operations related to domains.

*Precondition:*

# The admin user has access to the admin portal.
# At least one business owner is displayed in the *List View* screen (even if created erroneously).

*Steps to Reproduce:*

# Log in to the admin portal as an admin user.
# Navigate to the *Business Owners* section.
# Open the *List View* screen.
# Click the *Manage* button under a subdomain for any listed business owner.
# On the *Manage Business Owners* screen, attempt to click the *Domains Button*.

*Expected Result:*
The *Domains Button* should be actionable, allowing the admin user to manage domains related to the business owner.

*Actual Result:*
The *Domains Button* is not actionable and does not respond to user interaction.

column2: (SP20): Business Owners List displays a saved business owner despite no creation by the admin user
column28:
*Title:*
Business Owners List displays a saved business owner despite no creation by the admin user

*Description:*
The Business Owners (List View) screen shows one saved business owner, although the admin user has not created any business owners yet.

*Precondition:*

# The admin user has access to the admin portal.
# No business owners have been created by the admin user.

*Steps to Reproduce:*

# Log in to the admin portal as an admin user.
# Navigate to the *Business Owners* section.
# Open the *List View* screen for business owners.

*Expected Result:*
The *List View* screen should display a message indicating that no business owners have been created yet or show an empty list.

*Actual Result:*
The *List View* screen displays one saved business owner even though no business owners have been created by the admin user.

column2: (SP20): ERP Base URL Returns HTTP 301 Status Code After Session Creation
column28:
h3. *Title: ERP Base URL Returns HTTP 301 Status Code After Session Creation*

*Project/Module:* ERP System
*Severity:* High

----

h3. *Issue Description*

When attempting to visit the ERP base URL ({{https://testdomain.microtecdev.com:2050/erp}}) after successfully clearing all storage, sessions, and cookies, and creating a new session using Cypress, the system returns an HTTP 301 response status code. This indicates that the URL is being redirected permanently, which causes the navigation to fail.

----

h3. *Steps to Reproduce*

# Clear all storage, sessions, and cookies in the browser.
# Create a new session using Cypress.
# Attempt to visit the ERP base URL: {{https://testdomain.microtecdev.com:2050/erp}}.
# Observe the HTTP response status code.

----

h3. *Expected Behavior*

The ERP base URL should return an HTTP 200 status code and successfully load the ERP login or dashboard page.

----

h3. *Actual Behavior*

The ERP base URL returns an HTTP 301 status code, indicating a permanent redirection, which prevents the page from loading successfully.

----

column2: General: Search Function Sends Two Requests When Copy-Pasting Text in Payment In Screen.
column28:
*Description:*
In some screens like *Finance App* under the *Payment In Screen*, using the search function with a copy-paste action sends multiple network requests simultaneously. This behavior can lead to performance issues and unnecessary network traffic.

*Steps to Reproduce:*

# Navigate to *Finance App >> Payment In Screen*.
# Open the *Search* function.
# Copy a text string from the list view and paste it into the search bar.
# Monitor the network activity in the developer tools or logs.

*Actual Result:*

* Two network requests are triggered for a single copy-paste action in the search bar.

*Expected Result:*

* A single network request should be sent when performing a copy-paste search action.

column2: (SP20): Item Description Field Behavior in Stock Out Add Screen
column28:
h3. *Bug Report: Item Description Field Behavior in Stock Out Add Screen*

*Project/Module:* ERP System ? Inventory Management
*Severity:* Medium

----

h3. *Issue Description*

The *Item Description* field in the *Stock Out Add Screen* only displays the *Item Name*, while it should display both *Item Name* and *Item Variant Name*. This behavior is inconsistent with the *Stock In Add Screen*, where both *Item Name* and *Item Variant Name* are correctly displayed.

----

h3. *Steps to Reproduce*

# Navigate to the *Inventory >> Transaction* module.
# Open the *Stock Out Add Screen*.
# Select an item with variants.
# Observe the *Item Description* field.

----

h3. *Expected Behavior*

The *Item Description* field in the *Stock Out Add Screen* should display both the *Item Name* and the *Item Variant Name* (e.g., "ItemName - VariantName").

----

h3. *Actual Behavior*

The *Item Description* field only displays the *Item Name*, omitting the *Item Variant Name*, which leads to inconsistency with the behavior in the *Stock In Add Screen*.

column2: (SP20) :  Issues in Stock Out Add Screen When First Opening it
column28:
h3. *Title: Issues in Stock Out Add Screen*

*Project/Module:* ERP System ? Inventory Management
*Severity:* High

----

h3. *Issue Description*

The *Stock Out Add Screen* has multiple issues:

# The *"Source Document"* label does not display a *star symbol (*)*, indicating it as a required field.
# No *validation message* is displayed when the *"Source Document"* field is left empty, and the user clicks the *Save* button.
# The screen does not include a *default empty item line*, which is expected when opening the screen.

----

h3. *Steps to Reproduce*

# Navigate to the *Inventory >> Transaction* module.
# Open the *Stock Out Add Screen*.
# Check for the presence of a *default empty item line* when the screen loads.
# Observe the *"Source Document"* label for the required star symbol (*).
# Click the *Save* button without providing any value for the *Source Document* field.
# Observe the absence of a validation message.

----

h3. *Expected Behavior*

# The *"Source Document"* label should include a *star symbol (*)*, clearly indicating it as a required field.
# When the user clicks *Save* without providing a value for the *Source Document* field, a *descriptive validation message* should appear (e.g., "*Source Document is required*").
# The screen should display a *default empty item line* when first opened, allowing users to input item details.

----

h3. *Actual Behavior*

# The *"Source Document"* label does not include a star symbol (*), making it unclear that it is required.
# Clicking *Save* without entering a value for *Source Document* does not trigger any validation message.
# No *default empty item line* is displayed when opening the screen.

column2: (SP20): Missing Registration Option on Login Screen
column28:
*Bug Report: Missing Registration Option on Login Screen*

*Project/Module:* ERP System ? Authentication/Access Control
*Severity:* Medium

----

*Issue Description:*
The *Login Screen* does not provide an option for *new users to register* if they do not already have an account.

----

*Steps to Reproduce:*

# Navigate to the ERP system login page.
# Observe the login form.
# Note the absence of a *?Register? or ?Create Account?* link/button for unregistered users.

----

*Expected Behavior:*

* A *"Register"* or *"Create New Account"* button/link should be present below the login form.
* Clicking the link should navigate to a *user registration page* allowing new users to create accounts.
* Alternatively, the system should provide a *"Don't have an account? Register here"* message to guide new users.

*Actual Behavior:*

* No options for *account registration* or creating a new user account are visible.

column28:
in sales Invoice View Screen,

column2: (SP20): Design Issues in Branches List View
column28:
*Title: Design Issues in Branches List View*

*Project/Module:* ERP System ? Branch Management
*Severity:* Medium

----

*Issue Description:*
The *Branches List View* in the ERP system displays several *design inconsistencies* and *misaligned components*, leading to poor user experience and visual clutter. This affects the usability and readability of the branch data.

----

*Steps to Reproduce:*

# Navigate to *Branch Management* or *Organization Setup*.
# Open the *Branches List View*.
# Observe the table structure, row alignment, column headers, and spacing between elements.

----

*Expected Behavior:*

* The Activate / Deactivate Text should be centered in its containing component
* Column headers and table rows should be *aligned properly*.
* Adequate spacing and padding should be applied for *clear readability*.
* Design should follow the *standard table/list view design* used across the ERP system.

*Actual Behavior:*

* The Activate / Deactivate Text is not centered in its containing component
* Uneven padding between rows, leading to a *cluttered view*.
* *Extra margins* between sections, causing unnecessary white space.
* Some elements overlap or appear *out of grid alignment*.
* *Filter/search bar* misalignment with inconsistent spacing from the list table.

----

column2: (SP20): Design Inconsistency in Edit Branch Dialog
column28:
*Title: Design Inconsistency in Edit Branch Dialog*

*Project/Module:* ERP System ? Branch Management
*Severity:* Medium

----

*Issue Description:*
The *Edit Branch* dialog displays a *different design and layout* compared to the standard dialog forms used across the ERP system. This inconsistency affects the user experience and disrupts uniformity in the system's UI/UX design.

----

*Steps to Reproduce:*

# Navigate to *Branch Management*
# Click on *Edit* for any existing branch.
# Observe the layout, form fields, spacing, and buttons in the *Edit Branch Dialog*.
# Compare this with other dialog forms (e.g., Treasury, Customer, Vendor dialogs).

----

*Expected Behavior:*

* The Edit Branch dialog should adhere to the *standard form design* applied consistently across the ERP system.
* Form fields, buttons, and section spacing should match the design patterns used in *other module dialogs*.
* Uniformity in design improves usability and ensures a *seamless experience* for users.

*Actual Behavior:*

* The Edit Branch dialog has *misaligned form fields*, irregular spacing, and a *different button layout* compared to other dialog forms.
* The overall design *deviates from the standard* dialog forms across the ERP system, resulting in an inconsistent look and feel.

column2: (SP20): Selected Items Unchecked When Navigating Pages in Item Code Advanced Search Dialog
column28:
*Title: Selected Items Unchecked When Navigating Pages in Item Code Advanced Search Dialog*

*Project/Module:* ERP System ? Sales (Price Policy)
*Severity:* High

----

*Issue Description:*
When using the *Advanced Search Dialog* to select item codes in the *Price Policy* screen (Sales app), selected items are *unchecked* if the user navigates between pages in the dialog. This results in *data loss and ambiguity* during item selection, leading to potential errors in policy configuration.

----

*Steps to Reproduce:*

# Navigate to *Sales ? Price Policy ? Add/Edit Price Policy*.
# Click on *Item Code* to open the *Advanced Search Dialog*.
# Select multiple item codes from the first page.
# Navigate to the next page without clicking "Confirm."
# Return to the previous page.

----

*Expected Behavior:*

* Selected items should *remain checked and persist* when navigating between pages in the Advanced Search Dialog.
* Users should be able to *select multiple items across multiple pages* without losing prior selections.

*Actual Behavior:*

* Selected items from previous pages are *unchecked* when the user navigates to a different page.
* Users experience *ambiguity and potential errors* as previously selected items do not appear in the final selection after confirming.

----

column2: (SP20): Unformatted Text in Exported PDF Report ? Payment Out
column28:
*Title: Unformatted Text in Exported PDF Report ? Payment Out*

*Project/Module:* ERP System ? Finance (Payment Out)
*Severity:* Medium

----

*Issue Description:*
The PDF report exported from the *Payment Out* screen displays *unformatted text* with misaligned content, inconsistent font sizes, and overlapping fields. This affects the readability and professional presentation of the report.

----

*Steps to Reproduce:*

# Navigate to *Finance ? Transactions? Payment Out*.
# Open any completed *Payment Out* transaction.
# Click the *Export to PDF* button.
# Review the exported PDF for formatting issues.

----

*Expected Behavior:*

* The exported PDF should present a *clean, well-formatted layout* with properly aligned and readable text.
* Font sizes and spacing should be consistent, and tables should appear neatly within the page margins.

*Actual Behavior:*

* Text appears *misaligned* and lacks proper formatting.
* Overlapping sections and uneven font sizes are present.
* The report appears *cluttered and difficult to interpret*.

column2: (SP20): Unformatted Text in Exported PDF Report ? Payment In
column28:
*Bug Report: Unformatted Text in Exported PDF Report ? Payment In*

*Project/Module:* ERP System ? Finance (Payment In)
*Severity:* Medium

----

*Issue Description:*
The PDF report exported from the *Payment In* screen contains *unformatted and misaligned text*. The content appears cluttered, with inconsistent font sizes, missing spacing, and alignment issues.

----

*Steps to Reproduce:*

# Navigate to *Finance ? Payments ? Payment In*.
# Open any completed *Payment In* transaction.
# Click the *Export to PDF* button.
# Review the exported PDF.

----

*Expected Behavior:*

* The exported PDF should maintain a *consistent format*, with properly aligned and clearly readable text.
* Font sizes, spacing, and margins should be uniform and follow the ERP?s standard PDF export design.

*Actual Behavior:*

* Text appears *misaligned and unformatted*.
* Some fields overlap or lack proper spacing.
* Key details (such as amounts, dates, and descriptions) are difficult to read.

column2: (SP20): Show/Hide Columns in Payment Term Displays Only Actions Column When All Options Are Unchecked
column28:
h4. *Title:*

Show/Hide Columns in Payment Term Displays Only Actions Column When All Options Are Unchecked

----

h4. *Description:*

In the Payment Term section of the Finance app, the *Show/Hide Columns* functionality behaves incorrectly. When all column options are unchecked, the system displays only the "Actions" column, which should also be hidden along with the other columns.

----

h4. *Precondition:*

# Access to the Finance app and the Payment Term section.
# A table with configurable columns and a "Show/Hide Columns" option.

----

h4. *Steps to Reproduce:*

# Navigate to the Payment Term section in the Finance app.
# Click on the *Show/Hide Columns* option.
# Uncheck all available column options.
# Observe the table after closing the *Show/Hide Columns* configuration.

----

h4. *Expected Result:*

When all column options are unchecked, the table should display the descriptive columns [Code or Name), including the "Actions" column.

----

h4. *Actual Result:*

The table displays the "Actions" column, even when all column options are unchecked in the *Show/Hide Columns* functionality.

column2: (SP20): Incomplete Data in Exported Excel and PDF for Treasury Definition
column28:
h4. *Title:*

Incomplete Data in Exported Excel and PDF for Treasury Definition

----

h4. *Description:*

When exporting the Treasury Definition data to Excel or PDF formats, not all data is included in the exported files. Certain fields or records are missing, causing discrepancies between the displayed data in the system and the exported files.

----

h4. *Precondition:*

# Treasury Definition data is populated and available in the system.
# The export functionality for Excel and PDF is enabled.

----

h4. *Steps to Reproduce:*

# Navigate to the Treasury Definition section in the system.
# Verify that all data is displayed correctly on the screen.
# Export the data to Excel.
# Export the data to PDF.
# Open both exported files and compare them with the on-screen data.

----

h4. *Expected Result:*

The exported Excel and PDF files should contain all the data as displayed in the Treasury Definition section of the system.

----

h4. *Actual Result:*

The exported Excel and PDF files are missing some data fields or records, resulting in incomplete data compared to what is shown on the screen.

column2: (SP20) General : Filter Reset in List View When Navigating with Paginator
column28:
h4. *Title:*

Filter Reset in List View When Navigating with Paginator

----

h4. *Description:*

When a user applies a filter in any List view and navigates through different pages using the paginator, the system fails to retain the applied filter. As a result, the filter resets, and the user is presented with unfiltered data upon returning to the List view.

----

h4. *Precondition:*

# The user has access to a List view with a filter and a paginator implemented.
# A filter has been applied to narrow down the displayed data.

----

h4. *Steps to Reproduce:*

# Navigate to a List view (Payment In List View).
# Apply a filter (e.g., filtering by "Status: Posted").
# Use the paginator to move to another page (e.g., Page 2).
# Another way change the Maximum Count to be Displayed in the Page.
# Return to the original page or refresh the List view.

----

h4. *Expected Result:*

The applied filter should persist across different pages, and the List view should continue displaying filtered data regardless of navigation or refresh.

----

h4. *Actual Result:*

The filter resets when navigating through the paginator or refreshing the List view, and unfiltered data is displayed instead.

column2: (SP20): Unposted Payment Out Displayed in Recent Outgoing Transactions
column28:
*Title: Unposted Payment Out Displayed in Recent Outgoing Transactions*

*Project/Module:* ERP System ? Finance (Dashboard)
*Severity:* High

----

*Issue Description:*
In the *Finance App Dashboard*, *unposted Payment Out* transactions are incorrectly displayed under the *Recent Outgoing Transactions* section. This misclassification can lead to confusion and inaccurate financial reporting.

----

*Steps to Reproduce:*

# Navigate to *Finance ? Payments ? Payment Out*.
# Create a new *Payment Out* transaction and leave it in the *unposted* state.
# Go to the *Finance Dashboard*.
# Check the *Recent Outgoing Transactions* section.

----

*Expected Behavior:*

* *Unposted Payment Out* transactions should not appear in the *Recent Outgoing Transactions* section.
* Payment In transactions should only appear under *Incoming Transactions* if posted.

*Actual Behavior:*

* The *unposted Payment Out* transaction incorrectly appears in the *Outgoing Transactions* list.

column2: (SP20): Duplicate Journal Line Component in Customer Opening Balance Edit Screen
column28:
*Title: Duplicate Journal Line Component in Customer Opening Balance Edit Screen*

*Project/Module:* ERP System ? Finance (Customer Opening Balance)
*Severity:* Medium

----

*Issue Description:*
In the *Customer Opening Balance Edit Screen*, the *Journal Line* component is displayed *twice vertically*. One of the components appears dimmed and non-interactive, while the other is functional. This creates confusion and may lead users to mistakenly assume the form is incomplete or malfunctioning.

----

*Steps to Reproduce:*

# Navigate to *Sales? Customer Opening Balance*.
# Select an existing record and click *Edit*.
# Scroll to the *Journal Line* section.
# Observe that the Journal Line appears *twice vertically*? dimmed.

----

*Expected Behavior:*

* The *Journal Line* component should appear *once* in the form.
* Only the interactive, functional Journal Line should be visible.

*Actual Behavior:*

* *Two Journal Line components* are displayed vertically.
* The *dimmed* component cannot be edited, causing unnecessary UI clutter.

column2: Missing scroll bar in the Configuration popup window.
column28:
*Description:*
In the *Accounting App*, the *Configuration* popup window does not have a scroll bar, making it difficult for users to view and access all options or fields when the content exceeds the visible area.

*Steps to Reproduce:*

# Navigate to the *Accounting App*.
# Open a module that includes a *Configuration* popup.
# Open the *Configuration* popup.
# Observe the absence of a scroll bar when the content exceeds the visible area.

*Actual Result:*

* The *Configuration* popup window lacks a scroll bar, preventing users from viewing and interacting with all content.

*Expected Result:*

* The *Configuration* popup window should include a scroll bar to allow users to scroll and access all options and fields when the content is larger than the visible area.

column2: (SP20) : Duplicate Item Error in Price Policy Edit Screen
column28:
*Title:  Duplicate Item Error in Price Policy Edit Screen*

*Project/Module:* ERP System ? Pricing (Price Policy Management)
*Severity:* High

----

*Issue Description:*
When opening the *Edit Screen* for a saved price policy that contains *multiple lines with the same item and unit of measure (UoM)* but *different variants*, an unexpected error message appears:

*Error Message:*
_?There is a duplicated item with the same unit of measure.?_

This error prevents the user from accessing or editing the price policy.

----

*Steps to Reproduce:*

# Navigate to *Pricing ? Price Policies*.
# Select and open an existing *price policy* with multiple lines containing the *same item and UoM* but differing by variant (e.g., color, size).
# Attempt to *edit the policy*.
# The error dialog appears, and the screen does not load or becomes unresponsive.

----

*Expected Behavior:*

* The system should *allow multiple lines with the same item and UoM* as long as the *variants are different*.
* The price policy should load without errors, enabling the user to edit the lines individually.
* Validation should only trigger if *identical items, UoM, and variants* are duplicated.

*Actual Behavior:*

* An error is triggered incorrectly when variants differ.

column2: (SP20):General:  Unwanted Image Details Displayed in View Mode
column28:
*Title: Unwanted Image Details Displayed in View Mode*

*Project/Module:* ERP System ? General (Vendor Definition, Customer Definition, etc.)
*Severity:* Medium

----

*Issue Description:*
When viewing attached and saved images in *view mode* across various screens (e.g., Vendor Definition, Customer Definition), *unnecessary image details* such as file extensions, descriptions, and delete icons are displayed. These details take up excessive space, reducing the focus on the actual image.

----

*Precondition*:

There is a saved *Vendor Definition* or *Customer Definition* with attached image.

*Steps to Reproduce:*

# Navigate to *Vendor Definition* or *Customer Definition* screens.
# Upload and save an image in the record's attachment section.
# Switch to *View Mode* for the record.
# Observe the attached image and its surrounding details.

----

*Expected Behavior:*

* The attached image should be *cleanly displayed without excessive metadata*.
* Delete icons or file extensions should *not appear in view mode*.
* Only necessary details (like image name, if required) should be minimally visible.

*Actual Behavior:*

* *File extensions, descriptions, and delete icons* are shown alongside the image.
* These elements take up a significant portion of the *image container div*.
* The display appears cluttered, detracting from the image's visibility.

column2: (SP20): Misaligned Buttons in Subdomain Cards ? My Subscription Page
column28:
*Title: Misaligned Buttons in Subdomain Cards ? My Subscription Page*

*Project/Module:* ERP System ? My Subscription Page
*Severity:* High

----

*Issue Description:*
On the *My Subscription* page, the action buttons (e.g., Renew, Cancel, Edit) within each subdomain card are *misaligned*. The buttons do not maintain a consistent horizontal alignment, resulting in an uneven and unprofessional layout.

----

*Steps to Reproduce:*

# Navigate to the *My Subscription* page in the ERP system.
# Review the subdomain cards displayed under the active subscription section.
# Observe the action buttons within each card.

----

*Expected Behavior:*

* All buttons within the subdomain cards should be *uniformly aligned* horizontally.
* Buttons should maintain consistent spacing and positioning across all subdomain cards.

*Actual Behavior:*

* Buttons are *misaligned*, appearing at varying heights or distances from the edges of the subdomain card.
* The page layout appears inconsistent and visually cluttered.

column2: (SP20): General : Missing Scrollbar in Form Dialog
column28:
*Title: Missing Scrollbar in Form Dialog*

*Project/Module:* ERP System ? General Form Dialog (Treasury, Advanced Search, Item Selection)
*Severity:* High

----

*Issue Description:*
The form dialog used across the ERP system for creating new records (e.g., treasury creation) or selecting items from advanced search *does not display a scrollbar* when the form contains numerous vertical components. This results in the *inability to access and operate elements positioned at the bottom* of the dialog, preventing users from completing the form or saving the data.

----

*Steps to Reproduce:*

# Navigate to  Stock In.
# click Create button to open the Add Screen
# go to the table in the bottom, and Click Advanced Search Icon in the Item Code Cell
# Observe the lack of a scrollbar and the inability to reach the bottom components.

----

*Expected Behavior:*

* A *scrollbar should appear* when the dialog's content exceeds the visible area.
* Users should be able to *scroll vertically* to access and operate all components.
* Form submission should be possible without obstruction.

*Actual Behavior:*

* No scrollbar is present in dialogs with excessive vertical content.
* Components at the bottom of the form are *inaccessible and unresponsive*.
* Users cannot complete or submit forms, leading to operational blocks.

----

column2: (SP20): Excessive Padding and Margins in Bank Account Statement Screen
column28:
*Title: Excessive Padding and Margins in Bank Account Statement Screen*

*Project/Module:* Finance App ? Bank Account Statement Screen
*Severity:* Low (UI/UX)

----

*Issue Description:*
The *Bank Account Statement* screen in the Finance module contains excessive padding and margins between various content sections and panels. This results in a *disorganized layout*, causing unnecessary scrolling and reducing overall readability and efficiency.

----

*Steps to Reproduce:*

# Navigate to the *Finance* module.
# Open the *Bank Account Statement* screen.
# Observe the layout and spacing between sections, content blocks, and data panels.

----

*Expected Behavior:*

* Panels and content sections should be aligned with consistent and minimal padding/margin.
* The layout should maximize available screen space for readability without excessive white space.

*Actual Behavior:*

* Unnecessary padding and margins are present between panels and data rows.
* Excessive white space leads to reduced visibility of critical data, requiring additional scrolling.

column2: Incorrect Success Message After Editing Account
column28:
*Description:*
In the *Edit Mode* of the Chart of Account, the success message displayed upon saving changes is incorrect. It shows *"Account Updated Successfully"* instead of the more contextually accurate message *"Account Modified Successfully."*

*Steps to Reproduce:*

# Navigate to *Accounting App >> Master Data >> Chart of Account*.
# Open an account in *Edit Mode*.
# Make any changes to the account details.
# Save the changes.

*Actual Result:*

* The success message displayed reads *"Account Updated Successfully."*

*Expected Result:*

* The success message should read *"Account Modified Successfully"* to align with the action performed.

column2: Localization Issue in Account Statement List View
column28:
*Description:*
In the *Account Statement List View*, certain elements, such as labels, buttons, or column headers, doesn?t have their clear names , causing inconsistencies in the user interface.

*Steps to Reproduce:*

# Navigate to *Accounting App >> Reports >> Account Statement*.
# Observe the labels, buttons, and column headers in the list view.

*Actual Result:*

* Some elements in the *Account Statement List View* have confusing names.

*Expected Result:*

* All elements, including labels, buttons, and column headers, should have clear names for consistency and improved user experience.

column2: Exported Sheets Contain Blank Columns in Chart of Account
column28:
*Description:*
When exporting data from the *Chart of Account list view*, the exported Excel and PDF sheets include blank columns, making the exported data incomplete and confusing for users.

*Steps to Reproduce:*

# Navigate to *Accounting App >> Master Data >> Chart of Account*.
# Click the *Export* button and select either *Excel* or *PDF* format.
# Open the exported file.

*Actual Result:*

* The exported sheets contain blank columns that do not correspond to any data from the Chart of Account.

*Expected Result:*

* The exported sheets should include only columns with relevant data populated as displayed in the *Chart of Account* list view.

column2: (SP20):Return Purchase Invoice Add Screen, The System Generated Batch is Not Displayed.
column28:
In Case Item Type Was No Tracking and Has expiry Was True.

*Expected Result:* The System Generated Batch Should Displayed in Batch No Field.

*Actual Result:* The System Generated Batch is Not Displayed as in attach (*image (4).png*).

column2: (SP20):The Redirect of Return Purchase Invoice in Journal Entry List View Not Working.
column28:
When I Click on ?Rpiv_03?, 

*Expected Result:* The System Should Redirect The User To The Return Purchase Invoice Screen.

*Actual Result:* The Redirect of Return Purchase Invoice in Journal Entry List > View Not Working.

column2: (SP20):Return Purchase Invoice Add & Edit Screens, The Subtotal is Not Calculated Correctly.
column28:
The Subtotal of Return Purchase Invoice Should Be,

*Expected Result:* subtotal should be (To Return Qty * cost ).

*Actual Result:* It Calculated As (Original qty * cost).

column2: No Validation for Negative Rate Values in Edit Mode of Journal Entry
column28:
*Description:*
In the *Edit Mode* of journal entries, negative values can be entered in the *Rate* field without any validation or error message. This can lead to invalid financial records being created.

*Steps to Reproduce:*

# Navigate to *Transactions >> Journal Entry*.
# Open an existing journal entry in *Edit Mode*.
# Enter a negative value in the *Rate* field.
# Attempt to save the changes.

*Actual Result:*

* The system allows saving the journal entry with a negative rate value, with no error or validation.

*Expected Result:*

* The system should validate the *Rate* field to prevent negative values and display an appropriate error message, such as:
** "Rate cannot be a negative value."

column2: Attachment Still Appears After Clicking Cancel in Journal Entry Add Mode
column28:
*Description:*
 When a file is attached and the *Cancel* button is clicked, the screen closes, but the attached file remains linked to the entry. This can lead to confusion, as the user expects all changes, including attachments, to be discarded.

*Steps to Reproduce:*

# Navigate to *Transactions >> Journal Entry*.
# Click on the *Add* button to create a new journal entry.
# Attach a file in the *Attachments* section.
# Click on the *Cancel* button.
# Reopen the same entry in *Add Mode*.

*Actual Result:*

* The screen closes, but the attached file is still present when revisiting the entry.

*Expected Result:*

* Clicking the *Cancel* button should completely discard the attached file and any unsaved changes. Alternatively, the system should display a confirmation message, such as:
** "Are you sure you want to discard all changes, including attachments?"

(SP20): Save Button Not Functioning in Warehouse Edit Screen
column28:
*Title: Save Button Not Functioning in Warehouse Edit Screen*

*Project/Module:* Warehouse - Edit Screen
*Severity:* High

----

*Issue Description:*
In the *Warehouse Edit* screen, the *Save* button does not respond when clicked. This prevents users from saving any changes made to the warehouse details, causing configuration delays and blocking updates to critical warehouse information.

----

*Steps to Reproduce:*

# Navigate to the *Warehouse* module.
# Select an existing warehouse and click *Edit*.
# Modify any field (e.g., warehouse name, location, or JL Account).
# Click the *Save* button.

----

*Expected Behavior:*

* The *Save* button should save the changes and display a confirmation message.
* The user should be redirected to the warehouse list view or stay on the edit screen with a success notification.

*Actual Behavior:*

* The *Save* button is unresponsive.
* No error message or feedback is displayed.
* Changes to the warehouse record are not saved.

column2: Duplicate accounts with the same details should not be allowed.
column28:
*Description:*
It is currently possible to create multiple accounts with identical details. This behavior should be restricted to prevent data duplication and maintain data integrity.

*Steps to Reproduce:*

# Navigate to the *Accounting App*.
# Open the *Cost Center* module.
# Add a new account with specific details (e.g., Name, Code, Description).
# Attempt to add another account with the same details as the previously created account.
# Click *Save*.

*Actual Result:*

* The system allows the creation of multiple accounts with identical details without any warnings or restrictions.

*Expected Result:*

* The system should validate the account details and display an error message if a duplicate account is being added.
* The error message should clearly inform the user that an account with the same details already exists and prevent the save action.

column2: Warning message for required fields in Opening Balance Journal Entry is unclear in both Arabic and English.
column28:
*Description:*
The warning message displayed for required fields is not clear in either *Arabic* or *English*. This makes it difficult for users to understand which fields are missing or what actions are needed to proceed.

*Steps to Reproduce:*

# Navigate to the *Accounting App*.
# Open the *Opening Balance Journal Entry* module.
# Click ?*Create*? button
# Attempt to save a journal entry without filling in all the required fields.

*Actual Result:*

* A warning message appears, but its content is unclear in both Arabic and English, failing to guide the user effectively.

*Expected Result:*

* The warning message should clearly indicate which fields are missing or invalid.
* The message should be displayed in a clear and understandable format in both Arabic and English, based on the selected language.

column2: SP 20: Error Message Not Handled for Duplicate Serial in Stock Out
column28:
*Description:*
When the user adds the same serial in the *Stock Out* screen, the system does not handle the error message properly. Instead of providing a clear validation error, the system behavior becomes unpredictable, which can lead to user confusion and data entry issues.

*Steps to Reproduce:*

# Navigate to the *Stock Out* screen.
# Add a serial in the *Serial* field.
# Attempt to add the same serial again in another line.
# Observe the system response.

*Expected Result:*
The system should display a clear error message, such as "Duplicate serials are not allowed," and prevent the addition of duplicate serials in the Stock Out entry.

*Actual Result:*
The system does not display an appropriate error message, leading to inconsistent behavior or acceptance of duplicate serials.

column2: (SP20): Missing Column Filtering in Purchase Invoice
column28:
h3. *Title: Missing Column Filtering in Purchase Invoice*

*Project/Module:* ERP System - Purchase Invoice List View
*Severity:* Medium

----

*Issue Description:*
The *Purchase Invoice List View* is missing *column filtering functionality*, preventing users from filtering data based on specific columns. This limits the ability to search, sort, and organize purchase invoices effectively.

----

*Steps to Reproduce:*

# Navigate to the *Purchase Invoice* module.
# Open the *List View* of Purchase Invoices.
# Observe that there are no *filter icons or dropdowns* available for columns such as Invoice Number, Vendor, Date, Amount, etc.
# Attempt to filter by typing in the column header or right-clicking?no filtering options appear.

----

*Expected Behavior:*

* Each column in the *Purchase Invoice List View* should have a filtering option (icon or dropdown).
* Users should be able to filter by *Invoice Number, Vendor, Date, Amount, or Status* directly from the list view.

*Actual Behavior:*

* No column filtering options are available.
* Users must manually scroll through records or use the general search, which is inefficient for large datasets.

column2: No Error Message for Required CR or DB in Edit Mode
column28:
*Description:*
In *Edit Mode* for journal entries, when the *CR (Credit)* or *DB (Debit)* fields are left empty, no error message is displayed to inform the user about the missing required fields. This can lead to incomplete or invalid journal entries being saved unintentionally.

*Steps to Reproduce:*

# Navigate to *Transactions >> Opening balance Journal Entry*.
# Select an existing journal entry and switch to *Edit Mode*.
# Leave the *CR (Credit)* or *DB (Debit)* fields empty.
# Attempt to save the entry.

*Actual Result:*

* The system doesn?t allow saving but no action done.

*Expected Result:*

* An error message should appear when the *CR (Credit)* or *DB (Debit)* fields are left empty, such as:
** "Credit and Debit values are required to save the journal entry."

column2: (SP20): Incorrect Calculation of Debit and Credit Sums in Bank Account Statement
column28:
h3. *Title: Incorrect Calculation of Debit and Credit Sums in Bank Account Statement*

*Project/Module:* ERP System - Bank Account Statement
*Severity:* Critical

----

*Issue Description:*
The Bank Account Statement screen incorrectly calculates the total sums for Debit and Credit transactions. Instead of summing only the transactions within the selected period or filter criteria, the system sums all Debit and Credit values for all saved transactions, regardless of the applied filters (e.g., Payment In and Payment Out).

----

*Steps to Reproduce:*

# Navigate to the *Bank Account Statement* screen.
# Apply filters to specify a date range or limit transactions to Payment In or Payment Out.
# Review the displayed Debit and Credit sums at the bottom of the statement.
# Compare the sum to individual transactions visible on the screen.

----

*Expected Behavior:*

* The total sum of Debit under the debit column should have the correct value of the total sum of all the Debits in the Debit Column.
*  The total sum of Credit under the Credit column should have the correct value of the total sum of all the Credits in the Credit Column.

*Actual Behavior:*

* The total sum of Debit under the debit column *does not* have the correct value of the *total sum* of all the Debits in the Debit Column.
*  The total sum of Credit under the Credit column *does not* have correct value of the *total sum* of all the Credits in the Credit Column.

column2: Sidebar Menu Not Responsive in Arabic Mode
column28:
*Description:*
In the *Arabic Mode*, the sidebar menu in the application becomes unresponsive, preventing users from accessing the menu options effectively. This issue hinders navigation for Arabic-speaking users.

*Steps to Reproduce:*

# Switch the application language to *Arabic*.
# Navigate to *Reports >> Cost center reports*.
# Attempt to interact with the sidebar menu options.

*Actual Result:*

* The sidebar menu does not respond to clicks or hover actions in *Arabic Mode*.

*Expected Result:*

* The sidebar menu should function normally in *Arabic Mode*, allowing users to click on and access all menu options seamlessly.

column2: (SP20)General: Unexpected Behavior in Show/Hide Column Functionality
column28:
h3. *Title: Unexpected Behavior in Show/Hide Column Functionality*

*Project/Module:* ERP System - List View (Show/Hide Column)
*Severity:* Medium

----

*Issue Description:*
The Show/Hide column functionality exhibits unexpected behavior when all columns are unchecked. Despite unchecking all options, all columns remain visible in the list view. Additionally, descriptive columns such as *Code* or *Name* should not be part of the hideable options.

----

*Steps to Reproduce:*

# Navigate to any list view that supports Show/Hide column functionality (e.g., Return Purchase Invoice, Payment In, etc.).
# Click on the Show/Hide columns option.
# Uncheck all available column options.
# Observe the list view.

----

*Expected Behavior:*

* Unchecking all columns should hide all columns in the list view.
* Descriptive columns (e.g., *Code* or *Name*) should remain visible at all times and should not be available in the hideable options.

*Actual Behavior:*

* Unchecking all columns results in all columns still being displayed.
* Descriptive columns that are critical for identification (such as *Code* or *Name*) appear in the list of hideable options.

column2: Current Date in Cost Center Report Does Not Align with Current Financial Year
column28:
*Description:*
In the *Reports >> Cost Center Report*, the current date displayed does not correspond to the current date of the financial year. This misalignment can lead to confusion when reviewing reports tied to the financial calendar.

*Steps to Reproduce:*

# Navigate to the Accounting Module.
# Go to *Reports >> Cost Center Report*.
# Observe the current date displayed in the report header or filter fields.
# Compare it to the current date of the financial year.

*Actual Result:*

* The current date displayed does not match the date of the current financial year.

*Expected Result:*

* The current date in the *Cost Center Report* should reflect the current date as per the financial year set in the system.

column2: Account Code Redirects to Account Statement Report with Incorrect Search Criteria
column28:
*Description:*
When clicking on an *Account Code* in the *Trial balance*, the system redirects the user to the *Account Statement Report*. However, the search criteria in the report do not match the criteria associated with the selected account code, leading to incorrect or unexpected results.

*Steps to Reproduce:*

# Navigate to the Accounting Module.
# Go to *Reports >> Trial balance* or a similar section with a list view.
# Click on an *Account Code* in the list view.
# Observe the search criteria applied in the redirected *Account Statement Report*.

*Actual Result:*
The *Account Statement Report* is displayed, but the search criteria do not match the selected account code.

*Expected Result:*

* Clicking on an *Account Code* should redirect to the *Account Statement Report (*[https://testdomain.microtecdev.com:2050/accounting/transactions/account-statement|https://testdomain.microtecdev.com:2050/accounting/transactions/account-statement]*)* with the correct search criteria prefilled for the selected account code.

column28:
*Description:*
When printing data from Trial balance, the data displayed on the printed sheet does not match the actual data shown in the list view.

*Steps to Reproduce:*

# Navigate to the Accounting Module.
# Go to *Reports* *>> Trial balance* .
# Apply a filter to display specific data in the list view.
# Click on the *Print* button to generate the print sheet.

*Actual Result:*
The data displayed on the printed sheet does not align with the filtered data shown in the list view.

*Expected Result:*

* The data on the print sheet should exactly match the data displayed in the list view, including any applied filters or sorting.
* The system should ensure consistency between the displayed data and the printed report.

column2: (SP20): General: Descriptive Columns (e.g., Code, Name) Can Be Unchecked in Show/Hide Column Feature
column28:
h3. *Title*: Descriptive Columns (e.g., Code, Name) Can Be Unchecked in Show/Hide Column Feature

*Module*: Payment In / Payment out/ Any Grid with Show/Hide Column Feature
*Severity*: High
*Priority*: Critical
*Status*: Open

----

h3. *Description*:

The current implementation of the Show/Hide column functionality allows users to uncheck critical descriptive columns, such as "Code" and "Name." This results in the inability to identify records, leading to operational inefficiencies and potential errors when performing actions like editing or deleting records.

----

h3. *Steps to Reproduce*:

# Navigate to a grid (e.g., Business Owner List or Invoice List) with the Show/Hide column option.
# Click on the "Show/Hide Columns" button.
# Uncheck essential descriptive columns like "Code" or "Name."
# Observe that the grid no longer displays identifying information for each row, but the "Action" column (View/Edit/Delete) remains active.

----

h3. *Expected Result*:

* *Critical descriptive columns (e.g., "Code," "Name") should be fixed and unchangeable.*
* *Users should not be able to uncheck these columns.*
* *If the user attempts to uncheck them, a validation message should appear:*
*"Essential descriptive columns cannot be hidden to preserve record identification."*

----

h3. *Actual Result*:

* Descriptive columns are unchecked without restriction.
* The grid displays rows with only the "Action" column, making it impossible to distinguish records.

----

column2: (SP20): Delete Buttons Enabled for Posted Payments in Payment In List View
column28:
* *Title: Delete Buttons Enabled for Posted Payments in Payment In List View*

----

* *Description:*
*In the Payment In list view, the Delete action buttons are visible and enabled for payments that have already been posted. This behavior is incorrect as posted payments should not be Deleteable to maintain data integrity.*

----

* *Preconditions:*
** *User has access to the Payment In module.*
** *There are payments in the list that have been posted.*

----



* *Steps to Reproduce:*
*# *Navigate to Finance App > Transaction > Payment In List View.*
*# *Identify a posted payment.*
*# *Observe the Delete action button under the Actions column.*
*# *Click the Delete button.*

----

* *Expected Results:*
** *The Delete button should be disabled or hidden for posted payments.*
** *Posted payments should be locked to prevent modifications.*

----

* *Actual Results:*
** *Delete buttons are Visible and enabled.*
** *The user can open and Delete posted payments.*

column2: (SP20): Date Picker Malfunction in Payment Out Screen
column28:
h3. *Title: Date Picker Malfunction in Payment Out Screen*

*Project/Module:* Payment Out - Date Picker
*Severity:* Critical

----

*Issue Description:*
The date picker on the Payment Out screen fails to display months or days after the user attempts to change the year. This limits the ability to specify transaction dates.

----

*Steps to Reproduce:*

# Navigate to the Payment Out screen.
# Open the date picker to select a date.
# Change the year from the current year to another year.
# The month and day options disappear or fail to load.

----

*Expected Behavior:*

* The date picker should populate month and day data dynamically when a new year is selected.

*Actual Behavior:*

* The date picker shows an empty interface, lacking selectable month/day options.

column2: (SP20): Date Picker Malfunction in Payment In Screen
column28:
h3. *Title: Date Picker Malfunction in Payment In Screen*

*Project/Module:* Payment In - Date Picker
*Severity:* Critical

----

*Issue Description:*
The date picker on the Payment In screen does not display any months or days when the user attempts to change the year. This prevents users from selecting specific dates, blocking essential operations.

----

*Steps to Reproduce:*

# Navigate to the Payment In screen.
# Click on the date picker to select a date.
# Change the year using the year selector.
# Observe that the month and day sections do not display any data.

----

*Expected Behavior:*

* When the user changes the year, the date picker should display the correct list of months and days for the selected year.

*Actual Behavior:*

* The month and day sections appear blank, preventing date selection.

column2: SP20: Incorrect Calculations in UOM Screen
SP20: Missing Data in Exported Files
column28:
*Description:* When exporting the *Item Category List* to Excel or PDF, the *Details* and *Status* columns are included in the file, but the data within these columns does not appear. Values such as *True* or *False* are missing, leaving these columns blank in the exported files.

*Steps to Reproduce:*

# Navigate to the *Item Category List Screen*.
# Populate the list with records, ensuring the *Details* and *Status* columns contain values (e.g., True/False).
# Click on the *Export* button and select either *Excel* or *PDF*.
# Open the exported file to view its contents.

*Expected Result:*

* The exported file (Excel or PDF) should display the data within the *Details* and *Status* columns as they appear on the screen (e.g., True/False).

*Actual Result:*

* The *Details* and *Status* columns are present in the exported file, but their data is missing, leaving these fields blank.

column2: (SP20): Show/Hide Columns Functionality Not Displaying in Return Purchase Invoice Screen
column28:
*Bug Report: Show/Hide Columns Functionality Not Displaying in Return Purchase Invoice Screen*

*Project/Module:* ERP System - Return Purchase Invoice (List View)
*Severity:* High

----

*Issue Description:*
In the Return Purchase Invoice list view screen, the Show/Hide Columns functionality fails to display any column title options when clicked. This prevents users from customizing the visible columns, impacting their ability to manage and review data efficiently.

----

*Steps to Reproduce:*

# Navigate to the Return Purchase Invoice module.
# Access the list view screen.
# Click on the "Show/Hide Columns" icon or dropdown.

----

*Expected Behavior:*

* A list of available column titles should appear, allowing users to select or deselect columns for display.

*Actual Behavior:*

* No column title options are displayed when the Show/Hide Columns button is clicked. The dialog appears empty or does not respond.

column2: (SP20): Missing Arabic Translation for Column Titles in Show/Hide Functionality
column28:
*Title: Missing Arabic Translation for Column Titles in Show/Hide Functionality*

*Project/Module:* ERP System - UI/Localization
*Severity:* Medium

----

*Issue Description:*
The column titles in all ERP system modules, when accessing the "Show/Hide Columns" functionality, are not translated into Arabic. This inconsistency affects the usability and localization quality of the system for Arabic-speaking users.

----

*Steps to Reproduce:*

# Set the ERP system language to Arabic.
# Navigate to any list view (e.g., Payment In/Out, Treasury, Customer List).
# Click on the "Show/Hide Columns" icon or dropdown.
# Observe the column titles listed in the dialog.

----

*Expected Behavior:*

* All column titles should appear in Arabic when the system language is set to Arabic.

*Actual Behavior:*

* Column titles remain in English, even though the rest of the interface is in Arabic.

----

column2: (SP20):  Incorrect Scrollbar Position in Arabic Language Mode
column28:
*Bug Report: Incorrect Scrollbar Position in Arabic Language Mode*

*Project/Module:* ERP System - UI/Localization
*Severity:* Medium

----

*Issue Description:*
When the ERP system language is set to Arabic, the scrollbar remains on the right side of the screen. This behavior contradicts the standard RTL (Right-to-Left) interface expected in Arabic, where the scrollbar should appear on the left side.

----

*Steps to Reproduce:*

# Switch the ERP system language to Arabic.
# Navigate to any module with a vertical scrollbar (e.g., Item Definition, Payment In/Out).
# Observe the position of the scrollbar.

----

*Expected Behavior:*

* The scrollbar should appear on the left side in RTL mode (Arabic).

*Actual Behavior:*

* The scrollbar remains on the right side, following the LTR (Left-to-Right) standard.

----

*Impact Analysis:*

* This inconsistency disrupts the user experience and may cause usability issues for Arabic-speaking users.
* It reduces the overall localization quality and professionalism of the system.

column2: (SP:20): Vendor Definition List View: Export PDF Report without Text Formatting
column28:
*Title:* Vendor Category List View: Export PDF Report without Text Formatting

*Expected Result:* 

# The exported PDF report should include proper text formatting, such as font size, font style, and alignment.
# When I export the data with Arabic language, it exported with English language. 



*Actual Result:* 

# The exported PDF report may have inconsistent or missing text formatting.
# When I export the data with Arabic language, it should exported with Arabic language.

column2: (SP20): Inappropriate Validation Message on Sequence Screen
column28:
*Title: Inappropriate Validation Message on Sequence Screen*

*Project/Module:* ERP System - Sequence Management
*Severity:* Medium

----

*Issue Description:*
When the user attempts to save a sequence record with an empty detail line, the system triggers a vague or inappropriate validation message. The message does not clearly inform the user about the missing detail line, causing confusion.

----

*Steps to Reproduce:*

# Navigate to the Sequence Management module EX. (Customer Definition List View).
# Create a new Line.
# Leave the detail section empty.
# Click the "Save" button.
# Observe the validation message.

----

*Expected Behavior:*

* The system should display a clear and descriptive validation message, such as:
_"Detail section cannot be empty. Please Input the Required line Data before saving."_

*Actual Behavior:*

* The system displays a vague or unrelated message, failing to indicate the absence of detail lines.

column2: (SP20): ERP Side Slider - Modules Not Actionable in Arabic Mode When The Side Slider is Collapsed
column28:
*Title: ERP Side Slider - Modules Not Actionable in Arabic Mode When The Side Slider is Collapsed*

*Project/Module:* ERP System - Side Slider Navigation
*Severity:* High

----

*Issue Description:*
When the ERP system is set to Arabic mode, the side slider containing module navigation options becomes unresponsive. Hovering or clicking on the module options does not trigger any actions, preventing users from navigating to different modules.

----

*Steps to Reproduce:*

# Switch the ERP system language to Arabic.
# Hover over or click on the module options in the side slider.
# Observe that the modules do not respond or navigate to the respective screens.

----

*Expected Behavior:*

* Module options in the Collapsed side slider should be clickable and hoverable, allowing users to navigate to different ERP sections regardless of the language setting.

*Actual Behavior:*

* In Arabic mode, the Collapsed side slider module options are unresponsive to hover or click actions, preventing users from accessing critical ERP modules.

column2: (SP20): Localization Issues in Payment Out List Views
column28:
*Bug Report: Localization Issues in Payment Out List Views*

*Project/Module:* ERP System - Payment Out

*Severity:* Medium

*Issue Description:*
Localized translations are missing or incorrect in the Payment Out list views. Some labels, buttons, and column titles are displayed in the default language (English) instead of the localized language set by the user.

*Steps to Reproduce:*

# Navigate to the Payment Out module in Finance App.
# Switch the system language to a non-English language (e.g., Arabic).
# Open the list view for Payment Out or Payment Out.
# Observe the labels, column headers, and action buttons.

----

*Expected Behavior:*

* All labels, buttons, and column titles in the Payment Out list views should display in the selected language, consistent with the rest of the ERP system.

*Actual Behavior:*

* Some labels and columns are not translated and appear in English, even when a different language is selected.

column2: (SP20): Localization Issues in Payment In List Views
column28:
*Title: Localization Issues in Payment In List Views*

*Project/Module:* ERP System - Payment In 
*Severity:* Medium

----

*Issue Description:*
Localized translations are missing or incorrect in the Payment In list views. Some labels, buttons, and column titles are displayed in the default language (English) instead of the localized language set by the user.

----

*Steps to Reproduce:*

# Navigate to the Payment In module in Finance App.
# Switch the system language to a non-English language (e.g., Arabic,).
# Open the list view for Payment In or Payment Out.
# Observe the labels, column headers, and action buttons.

----

*Expected Behavior:*

* All labels, buttons, and column titles in the Payment In list views should display in the selected language, consistent with the rest of the ERP system.

*Actual Behavior:*

column2: (SP20): No Descriptive Message When Printing Without Data - Bank Account Statement Report
column28:
*Title: No Descriptive Message When Printing Without Data - Bank Account Statement Report*

*Project/Module:* ERP System - Bank Account Statement Report
*Severity:* Low

----

*Issue Description:*
When the user clicks the Print icon in the Bank Account Statement Report without any data displayed, no message is shown to inform the user. The system remains unresponsive, providing no indication of the issue.

----

*Steps to Reproduce:*

# Navigate to Finance App
# Navigate to the Bank Account Statement Report screen.
# Do not select or filter any bank account data.
# Click the Print icon.

----

*Expected Behavior:*

* A pop-up or inline message should notify the user that no data is available to print (e.g., "No bank account data available for printing. Please filter or select records.").

*Actual Behavior:*

* No message or action is triggered, leaving the user uncertain.

column2: (SP20): No Descriptive Message When Printing Without Data - Treasury Statement Report
column28:
*Title: No Descriptive Message When Printing Without Data - Treasury Statement Report*

*Project/Module:* ERP System - Treasury Statement Report
*Severity:* Low

----

*Issue Description:*
When the user clicks the Print icon in the Treasury Statement Report without any data displayed (no treasury selected or filtered), no descriptive or informative message is shown. The system does not provide feedback, leading to confusion.

----

*Steps to Reproduce:*

# Navigate to the Treasury Statement Report screen.
# Do not select or filter any treasury data.
# Click the Print icon.

----

*Expected Behavior:*

* A descriptive message should appear, informing the user that no data is available to print (e.g., "No data available for printing. Please filter or select treasury records.").

*Actual Behavior:*

* No message is displayed. The print process does not proceed, and the user is left without feedback.

column2: (SP20): Bank Definition Edit Screen Does Not Display Actual Balance
column28:
*Title: Bank Definition Edit Screen Does Not Display Actual Balance*

*Project/Module:* ERP System - Bank Definition
*Severity:* Medium

----

*Issue Description:*
The Edit screen for Bank Definition does not display the actual balance of the selected bank, even though the correct balance is successfully shown in the View screen. This discrepancy causes confusion and may lead to incorrect updates during the editing process.

----

*Steps to Reproduce:*

# Navigate to Finance App - Master Data
# Navigate to the Bank Definition module.
# Select a bank and view its details.
# Note the actual balance displayed in the View screen.
# Click "Edit" to modify the same bank record.
# Observe the absence of the actual balance on the Edit screen.

----

*Expected Behavior:*

* The Edit screen should display the actual balance of the bank, matching the value shown in the View screen.

*Actual Behavior:*

* The Edit screen does not display any balance information, despite the correct balance appearing in the View screen.

column2: (SP20): Treasury Related Currency Not Displayed in Treasury Statements
column28:
*Title: Treasury Related Currency Not Displayed in Treasury Statements*

*Project/Module:* ERP System - Treasury Statements - Finance App
*Severity:* High

----

*Issue Description:*
The system fails to display the treasury-related currency in treasury statements. When users generate or view treasury statements, the currency associated with the treasury account is missing, leading to confusion and potential misinterpretation of financial data.

----

*Steps to Reproduce:*

# Navigate to Finance App
# Navigate to the Treasury Statement module.
# Generate a treasury statement for a specific treasury account with valid Date Period.
# Review the statement details.
# Observe the absence of the treasury-related currency in the generated statement.

----

*Expected Behavior:*

* The treasury statement should display the currency associated with the selected treasury account.
* All relevant currency information should be clearly visible for accurate financial interpretation.

*Actual Behavior:*

* The generated treasury statement does not display the treasury-related currency.
* Users cannot verify the currency in which treasury amounts are calculated, leading to ambiguity in financial reports.

column2: (SP20): Missing Translations in App Selection Dialog
column28:
*Title: Missing Translations in App Selection Dialog*

*Project/Module:* ERP System - App Navigation
*Severity:* Medium

----

*Issue Description:*
When opening the app selection dialog to navigate between different apps in the ERP system, the titles of the apps are not translated. This results in the app names being displayed in the default language, regardless of the user's selected language.

----

*Steps to Reproduce:*

# Log into the ERP system and change the language to any non-default language (e.g., Arabic).
# Click on the app selection button to open the app navigation dialog.
# Observe the titles of the apps displayed in the dialog.

----

*Expected Behavior:*

* The app titles should be translated according to the selected language in the ERP system.

*Actual Behavior:*

* App titles remain in the default language and are not translated based on the user's language preference.

column2: Localization Issue as Date Field Dropdown Misaligned in Journal Entry List View
column28:
*Description:*
In the Journal Entry List View, when clicking on the *Date* field under certain localizations, the dropdown does not align properly under the label. Instead, it opens on the left side, causing a misalignment and potential usability issues.

*Steps to Reproduce:*

# Navigate to the Accounting Module.
# Go to *Transaction >> Journal Entry*.
# Change the system language to any language (Arabic) that uses a right-to-left (RTL) layout.
# Click on the *Date* field in the list view.

*Actual Result:*
The *Date* field dropdown opens on the left side, misaligned with the label.

*Expected Result:*
The *Date* field dropdown should open directly under the label, maintaining proper alignment regardless of the selected localization or layout direction.

column2: (SP20): Export Report Not Applying Filters in Payment In
column28:
*Bug Report: Export Report Not Applying Filters in Payment In*

*Project/Module:* Payment In - Export Report
*Severity:* Medium

----

*Issue Description:*
When exporting Payment In reports (PDF or Excel), the applied filters are not reflected in the exported file. The exported report contains the full list of records instead of the filtered subset.

----

*Steps to Reproduce:*

# Navigate to the Payment In module and apply filters (e.g., by date, hub, or status).
# Click the "Export" button to generate a PDF or Excel report.
# Open the exported file and review the contents.

----

*Expected Behavior:*

* The exported report should reflect the applied filters and only include the records matching the selected criteria.

*Actual Behavior:*

* The exported report ignores the applied filters and displays all records in the system.



----

column2: (SP20): View and Edit Buttons Enabled for Posted Payments Out List View
column28:
* *Title*: View and Edit Buttons Enabled for Posted Payments in Payment Out List View

----

* *Description*:
In the *Payment Out* list view, the *View* and *Edit* action buttons are visible and enabled for payments that have already been *posted*. This behavior is incorrect as posted payments should not be editable to maintain data integrity.

----

* *Preconditions*:
** User has access to the *Payment Out* module.
** There are payments in the list that have been *posted*.

----

* *Steps to Reproduce*:
*# Navigate to *Finance App > Transaction > Payment Out List View*.
*# Identify a *posted* payment.
*# Observe the *View* and *Edit* action buttons under the *Actions* column.
*# Click the *Edit* button.

----

* *Expected Results*:
** The *Edit* button should be *disabled or hidden* for posted payments.
** Posted payments should be locked to prevent modifications.

----

* *Actual Results*:
** Both *View* and *Edit* buttons are Visible and enabled.
** The user can open and edit posted payments.

column2: (SP20): Incorrect Data Displayed in Payment Method List View Paginator
column28:
* *Title*: Payment Method List View Paginator Displays Incorrect Data

----

* *Description*:
The paginator in the Payment Method list view shows incorrect information. The number of entries displayed does not align with the actual data, causing inconsistencies in page counts and navigation.

----

* *Preconditions*:
** Payment methods exist in the system.
** The list view contains more than one page of entries.

----

* *Steps to Reproduce*:
*# Navigate to *Finance App > Master Data > Payment Methods*.
*# View the list of payment methods.
*# Observe the paginator at the bottom of the list.
*# Compare the number of items displayed on the current page with the paginator count.
*# Click to navigate to the next page and check for discrepancies.

----

* *Expected Results*:
** The paginator should accurately reflect the number of records and pages.

----

* *Actual Results*:
** The paginator displays incorrect entry counts.

----

column2: (SP20): Payment Method Deletion Allowed Despite Existing Transactions
column28:
* *Title*: System Allows Deletion of Payment Method Used in Transactions

----

* *Description*:
The system permits the deletion of payment methods that are already associated with existing transactions. This can lead to data integrity issues and inconsistencies in financial records.

----

* *Preconditions*:
** At least one payment method is linked to completed transactions.

----

* *Steps to Reproduce*:
*# Navigate to *Finance App > Master Data > Payment Methods*.
*# Select a payment method that has been used in past transactions.
*# Click the *Delete* button.
*# Confirm the deletion.

----

* *Expected Results*:
** The system should display a validation message preventing deletion, such as:
**"This payment method cannot be deleted as it is associated with existing transactions."*

----

* *Actual Results*:
** The payment method is deleted without any warning or validation, even if linked to transactions.

column2: (SP20): Incorrect Icon Button Order in Treasury Definition List View
column28:
* *Title*: Treasury Definition - Action Column Icon Buttons Not Ordered Correctly

----

* *Description*:
The icon buttons under the *Action* column in the *Treasury Definition List View* are not arranged in the correct order. The expected order is:
*View* ? *Edit* ? *Delete*
However, the icons appear in a different or inconsistent order, leading to usability issues and potential misclicks.

----

* *Preconditions*:
** User is in the *Treasury Definition List View*.

----

* *Steps to Reproduce*:
*# Navigate to *Finance App > Master Data > Treasury Definition*.
*# View the *Action* column in the list view.
*# Observe the icon button order under the Action column.

----

* *Expected Results*:
** The buttons should be ordered as *View* (eye icon), *Edit* (pencil icon), and *Delete* (trash icon).

----

* *Actual Results*:
** The buttons appear in an incorrect order, which can lead to confusion.

column2: (Sp20):  Incorrect Icon Button Order in Payment Term List View
column28:
* *Title*: Payment Term - Action Column Icon Buttons Not Ordered Correctly

----

* *Description*:
In the *Payment Term List View*, the icon buttons under the *Action* column are not aligned in the correct order. The expected sequence should be:
*View* ? *Edit* ? *Delete*

----

* *Preconditions*:
** User is in the *Payment Term List View*.

----

* *Steps to Reproduce*:
*# Navigate to *Finance App > Master Data> Payment Terms*.
*# Check the Action column in the list view.
*# Observe the order of the icon buttons.

----

* *Expected Results*:
** The buttons should follow the logical order of *View*, *Edit*, and *Delete*.

----

* *Actual Results*:
** The buttons appear in an inconsistent or reversed order.

column2: (SP20)Payment Term: Export Button not Actionable
column28:
* *Title*: Payment Term: Export Button not Actionable

----

* *Description*:
When the user attempts to export payment terms after applying a search filter, the system returns a *500 Internal Server Error*. The error message indicates that the property *'CreatedOn'* is not found on the *ExportPaymentTermsDto* object. This prevents users from exporting filtered data, impacting reporting and documentation.

----

* *Preconditions*:
** User is in the *Payment Terms List View*.
** At least one search filter is applied.
** Export to PDF/Excel is triggered.

----

* *Steps to Reproduce*:
*# Navigate to *Finance App > Master Data > Payment Terms List View*.
*# Click the *Export* button to export the filtered list.

----

* *Expected Results*:
** The export function should successfully generate and download All Data in the selected format (PDF/Excel) If there is not any Filter.
** The export function should successfully generate and download the filtered list in the selected format (PDF/Excel).

----

* *Actual Results*:
** Export Button is not actionable
** No Data is Exported as Excel or PDF
